category: StartUp News: Latest Entrepreneurship News in Hindi with Inshorts

title: SRK's fans celebrate outside his house with crackers as Aryan gets bail | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Shah Rukh Khan's fans gathered outside his Mumbai residence 'Mannat' to celebrate as the Bombay High Court granted bail to the actor's son Aryan Khan. Two men were seen holding a banner that read 'Welcome Home Prince Aryan' as others burst crackers. Aryan, 23, was arrested on October 3, hours after drug raids on a cruise ship.
author: Daisy MowkeDaisy Mowke

title: India concerned about situation in Afghanistan, wants to work with us: Pentagon | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: Top US Defence Department official Colin H Kahl has said India is concerned about the current situation in Afghanistan. "They're concerned about the intersection between instability there and their counterterrorism concerns," Kahl, Under Secretary of Defence for Policy, added. "They (Indians) want to work with us on those issues, sharing intelligence, cooperating where we can," he further said.
author: Ankush VermaAnkush Verma

title: Paytm to open India's biggest ever IPO on November 8, will raise ₹18,300 crore | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications will open its IPO for subscription from November 8-10 to raise ₹18,300 crore. The IPO comprises a fresh issue of ₹8,300 crore and an offer for sale of up to ₹10,000 crore by existing shareholders. Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma will sell shares worth ₹402.65 crore. Paytm's IPO will be India's biggest ever public issue.
author: Kiran KhatriKiran Khatri

title: Paytm will not force employees to come to office: CEO | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Paytm will continue to allow employees to work from home and will not force them to come to the office, CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said on Thursday. He added, "We will be 100% flexible forever for good." In September, Sharma had tweeted, "Future of work (for technology/ knowledge companies) will be a choice between hybrid and work from home."
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: Raised $400 mn in 13 years, 70% of it still left: IPO-bound Policybazaar's Co-founder | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: Ahead of Policybazaar's IPO, Co-founder and CEO Yashish Dahiya told Moneycontrol that the company has raised $400 million over the last 13 years and there's still about "60-70% of that money" left. "We built Policybazaar and Paisabazaar at about $70 million each," he said. In these times building...a consumer internet brand with..$70 million isn't a bad result," he added.
author: Kiran KhatriKiran Khatri

title: Paytm fixes price band at ₹2,080-₹2,150 per share for ₹18,300-crore IPO | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Paytm parent One97 Communications has fixed the price band for its ₹18,300-crore IPO at ₹2,080-₹2,150 per share. The IPO, which will open for subscription from November 8-10, will be India's biggest ever public issue, a record that was previously held by Coal India. The company is reportedly seeking a valuation of $20 billion (around ₹1.5 lakh crore) through the IPO.
author: Kiran KhatriKiran Khatri

title: Nykaa raises ₹2,396 crore ahead of ₹5,350 crore IPO | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: Nykaa operator FSN E-Commerce Ventures has raised ₹2,396 crore from investors ahead of its initial public offer (IPO). The funding saw participation from T Rowe Price, JP Morgan, Goldman Sachs, SBI Mutual Fund, Axis Mutual Fund, Government Of Singapore and ICICI Prudential, among others. It will raise over ₹5,350 crore (around $714 million) through the IPO.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos are now worth nearly half a trillion dollars | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: The combined net worth of the world's two richest persons Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos neared $500 billion on Wednesday amid a rally in tech stocks. Tesla and SpaceX CEO's net worth rose to $292 billion, while Amazon and Blue Origin Founder Bezos' fortune rose to $196 billion. Their fortunes are more than Johnson & Johnson's market value, Bloomberg reported.
author: Kiran KhatriKiran Khatri

title: Don't think rumours on my life take away focus from work: Shraddha | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Actress Shraddha Kapoor in an interview has said that she doesn't think that all the rumours about her personal life take away the focus from her work. "I have never really spoken much about my personal life anyway," she added. The actress further said that she is shooting for an untitled Luv Ranjan directorial with Ranbir Kapoor and Dimple Kapadia.
author: Kriti KambiriKriti Kambiri

title: We are not against any community: SC on firecrackers ban  | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: Speaking about ban on firecrackers, the Supreme Court on Thursday said, "We are not against particular community. We want to send strong message that we are here for the protection of fundamental rights of citizens." "There is a particular impression being created...We've not put 100% ban on firecrackers. Everybody knows what the people of Delhi are suffering," the court added.
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

title: Have made $6 bn from Tesla from $380-mn investment: US billionaire | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: US billionaire Ron Baron has said that his fund has made $6 billion from Tesla from a $380-million investment made seven or eight years ago. "I think we'll probably be an investor for another 10 years, same with SpaceX," Baron told CNBC. "When I first met Elon 10 years ago...I was...skeptical about whether it [Tesla] would be successful," he added.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Japanese startup demonstrates its AI-equipped robotic arm in space | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: Tokyo space startup Gitai Japan successfully conducted a technology demonstration of its AI-equipped autonomous robotic arm inside the space station last week. The robot carried out two common crew tasks, operating cables and switches, and assembling structures and panels. It was sent to orbit aboard a SpaceX Dragon capsule earlier in August.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: US issues its 1st passport with 'X' gender marker | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: The US Department of State on Wednesday said that it had issued the first American passport with an "X" gender marker. The department did not identify the passport recipient, but Dana Zzyym, an intersex activist, said that they received it. The department said it is committed to promoting the freedom, dignity, and equality of all people – including LGBTQI+ persons.
author: Ankush VermaAnkush Verma

title: Acko Insurance becomes India's 34th unicorn this year with $255 million funding | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: Amazon-backed Acko Insurance has become a unicorn after it raised $255 million in a funding round led by private equity firms General Atlantic and Multiples Private Equity. The five-year-old Bengaluru-based startup's valuation has risen to $1.1 billion, making it India's 34th unicorn this year. It is also the second insurtech startup to turn unicorn this year, after Digit Insurance.
author: Kiran KhatriKiran Khatri

title: Rajasthan teacher arrested for WhatsApp status celebrating Pak's win against India | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: Nafisa Attari, a private school teacher in Rajasthan's Udaipur who was expelled from her job after she posted a WhatsApp status celebrating Pakistan's win against India in the T20 World Cup, was arrested on Wednesday. Her phone was also seized as part of the investigation. Police said, "She said it was done as a joke but it was a mistake."
author: Apaar SharmaApaar Sharma

title: We are not seeking an arms race with China: Taiwan amid tensions | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: Taiwan's Defence Ministry said it'll "not engage in an arms race with China" and "will not seek military confrontation". "But in...face of....Chinese...threat to our national security, we'll do our best to defend our...sovereignty and will never give in under duress," it added. This comes amid rising tensions between Taiwan and China and repeated violation of Taiwan's airspace by Chinese military.
author: Athira SasidharanAthira Sasidharan

title: Uber to offer 50,000 Tesla rentals to US ride-hail drivers by 2023 | Automobile News | Inshorts
news_articles: Uber has partnered with Hertz to offer 50,000 Tesla vehicles as a rental option to its drivers by 2023. Drivers will be able to rent a Tesla starting on November 1 in Los Angeles, San Francisco, San Diego and Washington DC, with the programme expanding nationwide later. The programme could expand to 1.5 lakh Teslas during the next three years.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: No coercive action against Dream11 founders till Nov 9: K'taka HC to govt | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Karnataka High Court has directed the state government not to take coercive action against Dream11 founders, Bhavit Sheth and Harsh Jain, until November 9 over the state's online gambling law. They moved to court, seeking to quash an FIR filed by the police. Earlier, a case was registered against them for continuing operations after the law came into effect.
author: Krishna RajKrishna Raj

title: Nykaa IPO subscribed 1.55 times on Day-1 | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: The initial public offering (IPO) of Nykaa's operator, FSN E-Commerce Ventures, was subscribed 1.55 times on the first day of the issue. It received bids for over 4.09 crore equity shares against an IPO size of 2.64 crore, data showed. The portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 3.5 times, while that of qualified institutional buyers was subscribed 1.39 times.
author: Krishna RajKrishna Raj

title: SpaceX spaceship faced urine leak issue during its first private flight | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: SpaceX's Crew Dragon spaceship faced a urine leak during its first private flight last month. According to William Gerstenmaier, a SpaceX vice-president, a tube came unglued during SpaceX's flight, spilling urine on to fans and beneath the floor. "We've fixed this problem in the tank by essentially making it an all-welded structure," Gerstenmaier said.
author: Ankush VermaAnkush Verma

title: Profitability is a choice, not a priority: IPO-bound Policybazaar's Co-founder | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: Talking about IPO-bound Policybazaar's losses being halved to ₹150 crore in 2020-21, Co-founder and CEO Yashish Dahiya said, "Profitability is a choice which we can achieve any quarter we wish to. It isn't a priority." "On a unit economics basis, the business is profitable...proof of it is that we haven't spent 70% of the money that we've raised," he added.
author: Kiran KhatriKiran Khatri

title: Google to remove pictures of under-18s from its search results on request | Technology News | Inshorts
news_articles: Google has launched a safety feature to remove images of anyone below the age of 18 from its search results at the request of the individual under 18 or their parent or guardian. Originally announced in August, the feature is now widely available. Removal of images can be requested through a Google Search Help page by submitting the image URLs.
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: Who is Anita Anand, Indian-origin woman who's Canada's new Defence Minister? | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: Indian-origin Anita Anand, the 54-year-old who's Canada's new Minister of Defence, is of Tamilian-Punjabi heritage as her father was from Tamil Nadu and her mother was from Punjab. She has worked as a scholar, lawyer, and researcher. She holds a BA in Jurisprudence from the University of Oxford, a Master of Laws from the University of Toronto and other degrees.
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: Amazon, Verizon partner to offer satellite internet in rural areas | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: US-based Verizon is partnering with Amazon to use its satellite internet system to offer rural broadband access in the US. Amazon's Project Kuiper, a network of 3,236 satellites, aims to offer high-speed internet globally. The firms will initially concentrate on expanding Verizon's LTE and 5G services using Amazon's Project Kuiper for backhaul, boosting coverage in areas with no high-speed data.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Ostriches seen running alongside vehicles on busy Pakistan road; video viral | Miscellaneous News | Inshorts
news_articles: A video showing two ostriches running alongside vehicles on the Canal Road in Pakistan's Lahore has gone viral on social media. Pakistani news channel ARY News reported that one of the flightless birds died after a man attempted to catch it from its neck. The ostriches had reportedly escaped from somewhere in the outskirts of Lahore.
author: Ankush VermaAnkush Verma

title: UPPCB to conduct special air quality monitoring for Noida, Ghaziabad | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board (UPPCB) has decided to conduct special air quality monitoring in Noida and Ghaziabad. It will be conducted for one week during the pre-Diwali period and again for another week after the festival concludes, to find out the impact of toxic pollutants. The inputs will be sent to IITR Lucknow for further analysis.
author: Sakshi SharmaSakshi Sharma

title: Legacy companies eat Ola, Ather, Tork & SmartE (OATS) for breakfast: Rajiv Bajaj | Automobile News | Inshorts
news_articles: Bajaj Auto's MD Rajiv Bajaj on Thursday took a jibe at startups that have entered the electric scooter segment and said that legacy companies like theirs eat OATS (Ola, Ather, Tork Motors and SmartE) for breakfast. "I'm going to bet on BET — Bajaj, (Royal) Enfield and TVS," he said. "They have a proven track record," he added.
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: Swiss Re to buy 23% stake in Paytm Insuretech for about ₹920 crore | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Paytm on Wednesday announced that Switzerland-based reinsurance firm Swiss Re will buy a 23% stake in its insurance unit, Paytm Insuretech, for about ₹920 crore. Swiss Re will invest by way of equity shares and compulsorily convertible preference shares, it added. Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma will also make an investment in Paytm Insuretech along with Swiss Re.
author: Krishna RajKrishna Raj

title: Two-headed calf that was born with pig-like body dies in Russia | Miscellaneous News | Inshorts
news_articles: A two-headed calf with a pig-like body was recently born in Russia's Khakassia. However, the calf did not survive and its mother also died a few days later. Khakassia's Veterinary Medicine Department said, "The main reason for animals being born with genetic abnormalities is a change in the genome. The reasons for mutations...are caused by their external and internal environment."
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

title: In 2 yrs, Alia made more money than I ever did in my 50 yrs as a filmmaker: Mahesh | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Mahesh Bhatt, speaking about daughter Alia Bhatt in an interview with Elle magazine, said, "She's a fire of her own." "Although I was a filmmaker, we always lived on the edge of the industry," he added. Bhatt further said in two years Alia had made more money than he ever did in his 50 years as a filmmaker.
author: Daisy MowkeDaisy Mowke

title: Musk's team didn't know he was moving Tesla HQ from California: Govt | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: Director of California Governor Gavin Newsom's Office of Business and Economic Development Dee Dee Myers has said Tesla CEO Elon Musk had not told his team about moving Tesla's headquarters from California to Texas. She added California government officials were also not informed about the plans. "I don't think anybody knows...what it means that he's moving his headquarters," Myers said.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: BJP corporator booked for cheating a contactor of ₹3 lakh in Pune | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: Pune police have booked BJP corporator Dhanraj Ghogare and three others for cheating a contractor of ₹3 lakh between August 2020 and October 2021. The complainant, Nikhil Divse, alleged Ghogare had promised him a contract and demanded ₹3 lakh. He allegedly paid the amount but didn't get the contract. When asked for refund, Ghogare and other accused reportedly abused Divse.
author: Athira SasidharanAthira Sasidharan

title: Male guard cuts woman RAS exam candidate's top sleeves to curb cheating; NCW criticises | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has condemned the incident where a male security guard was seen cutting the sleeves of a top worn by a female candidate outside an exam centre for Rajasthan Administrative Services. "How can they cut clothes of girls in the name of controlling cheating? This is atrocious," NCW Chairperson Rekha Sharma said.
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

title: Europe reported most COVID-19 cases, deaths last week: WHO | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: The World Health Organization (WHO) expressed concerns over the worsening coronavirus situation in Europe as the region reported maximum number of COVID-19 cases and deaths over the last week. Europe reported an 18% rise in new COVID-19 cases last week, a fourth straight weekly increase for the region, WHO said. Europe also saw 14% spike in coronavirus-related deaths, it added.
author: Athira SasidharanAthira Sasidharan

title: Indian market has 3 key beauties: Paytm CEO ahead of ₹18,300-crore IPO | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Vijay Shekhar Sharma, the CEO of Paytm that plans to raise ₹18,300 crore in India's biggest IPO, told Moneycontrol, "Indian market has three key beauties." Sharma said, "It has a large number of underserved customers...Second, there's a large customer base who are smartphone (users)." He added, "The third is a market where there's a new product to serve to customers."
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: US General Mark Milley confirms China's hypersonic weapon system test | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: US General Mark Milley has confirmed that China recently conducted a test of a hypersonic weapon system. Milley said, "[It] was a...significant event of a test of a hypersonic weapon system...[It's] very concerning." In July, China had launched a nuclear-capable hypersonic weapon that orbited the earth before reentering the atmosphere and finally missing its test target, Financial Times reported.
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

title: Retail portion of Nykaa's ₹5,352-crore IPO fully booked in an hour of opening | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Retail portion of Nykaa's ₹5,352-crore IPO was subscribed 100% within an hour of opening on Thursday, according to BSE data. However, its overall subscription stood at 0.24 times after an hour. The price band for the IPO, which will remain open till November 1, was fixed at ₹1,085-1,125 per share. The company is seeking a valuation of about ₹53,204 crore.
author: Kiran KhatriKiran Khatri

title: Taliban eager to have dialogue with world: Chinese Foreign Minister | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: At a virtual conference in Iran, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said that the Taliban is eager to have a dialogue with the world. Wang also urged the international community to help Afghanistan's development. Notably, China has announced $1 million in humanitarian aids to Afghanistan. Meanwhile, the Taliban has said that it'll form committees with China for "strengthening" bilateral relations.
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

title: Supreme Court quotes George Orwell's novel '1984' in Pegasus judgement | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Supreme Court on Wednesday appointed an independent expert committee into the allegations of spying using Israeli spyware Pegasus. The apex court's 46-page-long judgement opened with a quote from English novelist George Orwell's novel 'Nineteen Eighty-Four' (also stylised as 1984). "If you want to keep a secret, you must also hide it from yourself," the bench wrote in its judgement.
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: Gosavi, NCB's witness in Aryan case, sent to police custody till Nov 5 | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: A court in Pune on Thursday remanded private detective KP Gosavi, who is Narcotics Control Bureau's independent witness in the Mumbai cruise drugs case, to police custody till November 5 in connection with an old cheating case. Gosavi, who was absconding, was arrested by Pune Police earlier. Gosavi's selfie with Aryan Khan had gone viral.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Cong is limited to Twitter space, shows lackadaisical approach: TMC | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Thursday alleged that the Congress has taken no initiative to build an opposition alliance and it is limited to Twitter space. In an editorial in its mouthpiece 'Jago Bangla', TMC said, "We want an alliance to be formed against BJP. We have said this to Congress too. But it's least bothered and shows a lackadaisical approach."
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Picture abhi baaki hai mere dost: Maharashtra Minister Malik after Aryan gets bail | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik on Thursday tweeted, "Picture abhi baaki hai mere dost (The picture is still not over, my friend)." His tweet came soon after Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan was granted bail by Bombay High Court in Mumbai cruise drugs case. Arbaaz Merchantt and Munmun Dhamecha were also granted bail.
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

title: 2 Ludhiana students fall into 15-feet-deep crater as road caves in | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: Two students riding a scooter in Punjab's Ludhiana fell into a 15-feet-deep crater after a portion of a road suddenly caved in on Thursday. The students were rescued with the help of a ladder while their two-wheeler was completely submerged in sewage water. "Fortunately, sewer water didn't accumulate in the crater, otherwise the students could have drowned," an eyewitness said.
author: Shalini OjhaShalini Ojha

title: Govt asks IRCTC to share 50% of service charge from e-ticketing | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Railways Ministry has asked the IRCTC to share 50% of its proceeds of service charge on e-ticketing. The IRCTC will start sharing half of the convenience fees with the government from November 1, 2021. Analysts believe the development may impact IRCTC's revenues in the future as a large chunk of IRCTC's revenues come from internet ticketing services.
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: Star system will never go, but OTT created new stars: Zareen Khan | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Actress Zareen Khan in an interview has said that while the fascination with stars will never go, OTT content has created new stars overnight. She further said that in theatres, limited stars were seen and worshipped. "Now people who maybe do not come from a Bollywood background but are very good with their talent should be called stars," Zareen added.
author: Kriti KambiriKriti Kambiri

title: Centre releases ₹44,000 cr to states, UTs as GST compensation shortfall | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Ministry of Finance has released ₹44,000 crore to states and Union Territories with legislature to compensate them for the shortfall in GST revenue. With this, the total amount released in 2021-22 as GST compensation reached ₹1.59 lakh crore, the ministry said. "It's expected...this release will help...states and UTs in planning...public expenditure among other things," it added.
author: Krishna RajKrishna Raj

title: New land border law will not affect existing border treaties: China | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: China said that its new 'Land Boundary Law' won't impact existing boundary treaties nor will it change "existing practices in our cooperation with neighbouring nations". It said the law, which aims to manage border-related matters at a legal level to strengthen border defence, doesn't change the country's position on border-related issues. This comes after India raised concerns over the law.
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

title: Non-bailable warrant issued against former Mumbai Police Commissioner | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: A court in Thane on Thursday issued a non-bailable warrant against former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh in connection to an extortion case. The Crime Branch of Mumbai Police had earlier submitted in court that Singh is untraceable. An extortion case was filed against Singh, Sachin Waze and others at Goregaon Police Station in July.
author: Shalini OjhaShalini Ojha

title: Delhi HC notice to RBI, SBI over banning UPI payments in crypto exchanges | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Delhi High Court on Thursday issued notice to RBI, SBI, NPCI and others on a petition seeking the rollback of the decision of prohibiting UPI payments in the crypto exchanges. The plea alleged that SBI's decision of blocking UPI services for WazirX users violated a Supreme Court judgement. The matter is now slated for hearing on December 24.
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: Pics show Shah Rukh Khan with his legal team after Aryan Khan gets bail | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Hours after son Aryan Khan was granted bail by Bombay High Court in Mumbai cruise drugs case, pictures showing Shah Rukh Khan with his legal team surfaced online on Thursday. "No possession, no evidence, no consumption, no conspiracy, right from first moment when he (Aryan) was detained on October 2! Satyameva Jayate," legal team of lawyer Satish Maneshinde said.
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

title: First Iranian food festival in Hyderabad being held till October 31 | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Consulate General of the Islamic Republic of Iran is hosting the first Iranian food festival in Hyderabad. Various Persian delicacies are being served during the festival, which will be held till October 31. A celebrity chef from Iran said some of the dishes have been prepared using authentic rose water brought here from Iran.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Pune man searching for wife mistaken as thief, beaten up with rods | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: A 27-year-old man searching for his wife after she left home following a fight with him was mistaken as a thief and thrashed by three people in the Pune district of Maharashtra. The man was beaten up with iron rods on the intervening night of Tuesday and Wednesday. He was critically injured in the incident.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: There is a God: SRK's manager Pooja Dadlani after Aryan Khan is granted bail | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: After Bombay High Court on Thursday granted bail to Aryan Khan in the Mumbai cruise drugs case, Shah Rukh Khan's manager Pooja Dadlani reacted. Taking to Instagram Stories, she wrote, "There is a God." "Thank you everyone for your love and prayers. Truth prevails," Pooja added. Aryan is likely to come out of jail by tomorrow or Saturday.
author: Daisy MowkeDaisy Mowke

title: Noida DM Suhas LY recommended for Arjuna Award | Sports News | Inshorts
news_articles: Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas Lalinakere Yathiraj has been recommended for the Arjuna Award by the selection committee of the National Sports Awards. He won a silver medal in the final of the men's singles SL4 category at the Tokyo Paralympics held in September. "I thank all the citizens for giving me so much love and affection," he said.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Might work in UP, not here: Delhi HC to UP Police in runaway couple's marriage case | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: Delhi High Court has criticised UP's Shamli Police for arresting two family members of a Delhi man who married a woman against her family's wishes in July. Calling the arrests illegal as they were made without informing Delhi Police, the court said, "It might work in UP, not here." The arrests were made after a complaint by the woman's parents.
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

title: Chose to do stunts myself, no body doubles: Nitu on H'wood debut | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Actress Nitu Chandra has revealed that she chose to do her own stunts without body doubles in her Hollywood debut film 'Never Back Down: Revolt'. "Being a black belt 4th Dan in Taekwondo, I was confident about this role," she added. Nitu further said her role in the film was her shot at doing something new as an actor.
author: Kriti KambiriKriti Kambiri

title: Breaking News Headlines: Read All News Updates in Hindi | Inshorts
news_articles: बॉम्बे हाईकोर्ट ने मुंबई क्रूज़ ड्रग्स मामले में शाहरुख खान के बेटे आर्यन खान को ज़मानत दे दी है। इससे पहले मजिस्ट्रेट अदालत और एनडीपीएस की एक विशेष अदालत ने आर्यन की ज़मानत याचिका खारिज कर दी थी। नार्कोटिक्स कंट्रोल ब्यूरो (एनसीबी) ने आर्यन को 2 अक्टूबर को हिरासत में लिया था और बाद में उन्हें गिरफ्तार कर लिया। केंद्र सरकार ने देशभर में कोविड-19 प्रतिबंधों को 30 नवंबर तक बढ़ा दिया है। इससे पहले के आदेश में सरकार ने कहा था कि कंटेनमेंट ज़ोन में सामूहिक सभा पर रोक जारी रहनी चाहिए। सरकार ने कहा था कि कोविड-19 के मामले बढ़ने की संभावना से बचने के लिए 5-सूत्री रणनीति (टेस्ट-ट्रैक-ट्रीट-वैक्सीनेशन और कोविड उपयुक्त व्यवहार) का पालन होना चाहिए।केंद्रीय मंत्री रामदास अठावले ने कहा, "देश में शराब पीने वालों को जेल नहीं भेजा जाता लेकिन कानून में ड्रग्स का सेवन करने वालों को जेल भेजने का एक प्रावधान है।" उन्होंने कहा, "हमारे मंत्रालय को लगता है कि ड्रग्स का सेवन करने वालों को जेल नहीं बल्कि सुधार गृह भेजा जाना चाहिए...कानून को बदलने की ज़रूरत है।"सुप्रीम कोर्ट ने नैशनल टेस्टिंग एजेंसी (एनटीए) को मेडिकल प्रवेश परीक्षा एनईईटी-यूजी 2021 का परिणाम जारी करने की इजाज़त दे दी। कोर्ट ने बॉम्बे हाईकोर्ट के आदेश पर रोक लगा दी जिसमें परिणाम पर रोक लगाकर एनटीए को दो छात्रों की परीक्षा दोबारा लेने को कहा गया था। छात्रों के अनुसार, उन्हें प्रश्न-पुस्तिकाएं और उत्तर-पुस्तिकाएं अलग-अलग सीरीज़ की मिली थीं।दिल्ली हाईकोर्ट ने जुलाई में अपने परिवार की मर्ज़ी के खिलाफ एक महिला से शादी करने वाले दिल्ली के व्यक्ति के परिवार के 2 सदस्यों को गिरफ्तार करने के लिए शामली (यूपी) पुलिस की आलोचना की है। गिरफ्तारी को अवैध बताते हुए कोर्ट ने कहा, "यह यूपी में चलता होगा...यहां नहीं।" गिरफ्तारी महिला के माता-पिता की शिकायत पर हुई थी।महाराष्ट्र सरकार ने गुरुवार को बॉम्बे हाईकोर्ट को बताया कि वह एनसीबी के ज़ोनल डायरेक्टर समीर वानखेड़े को 3 दिन का नोटिस दिए बिना गिरफ्तार नहीं करेगी। मुंबई पुलिस ने मुंबई क्रूज़ ड्रग्स केस की जांच कर रहे वानखेड़े के खिलाफ उगाही के आरोपों को लेकर जांच शुरू की है। एनसीबी ने भी उनके खिलाफ जांच के आदेश दिए हैं। नोएडा सेक्टर-46 के आम्रपाली सफायर सोसायटी के सुरक्षाकर्मियों ने वहां रहने वाले 2 युवकों को लाठियों से पीटा जिसका एक वीडियो वायरल हुआ है। पुलिस के अनुसार, इससे पहले दोनों पीड़ितों और एक सुरक्षाकर्मी के बीच पार्किंग स्टिकर को लेकर झड़प हुई थी जिसके बाद यह घटना घटी। बतौर खबर, घटना के बाद 6 सुरक्षाकर्मियों को हिरासत में लिया गया।हरियाणा महिला आयोग ने राज्य की पुलिस को फर्ज़ी रेप केस दर्ज कराने के आरोपों को लेकर एक महिला के खिलाफ जांच करने को कहा है। एक शिकायत के अनुसार, महिला ने गुरुग्राम के विभिन्न थानों में सालभर में 7 अलग-अलग लोगों के खिलाफ रेप केस दर्ज कराए। बकौल रिपोर्ट्स, 7 में से 2 मामले फर्ज़ी पाए गए।राष्ट्रीय महिला आयोग (एनसीडब्ल्यू) ने उस घटना की आलोचना की है जिसमें राजस्थान लोक सेवा आयोग (आरएएस) के एक परीक्षा केंद्र के बाहर एक पुरुष गार्ड एक महिला के टॉप की स्लीव काट रहा है। एनसीडब्ल्यू की अध्यक्ष रेखा शर्मा ने इसे लेकर कहा, "नकल रोकने के नाम पर वह लड़कियों के कपड़े कैसे काट सकता है...यह घटिया हरकत है।"लुधियाना (पंजाब) में गुरुवार को सड़क के एक हिस्से के धंसने के बाद स्कूटर सवार 2 छात्र 15-फीट गहरे गड्ढे में गिर गए। छात्रों को सीढ़ी की मदद से बचाया गया जबकि  स्कूटर पूरी तरह से सीवेज के पानी में डूब गया। एक प्रत्यक्षदर्शी ने कहा, "सौभाग्य से, गड्ढे में सीवर का पानी जमा नहीं था...नहीं तो छात्र डूब जाते।"सुप्रीम कोर्ट ने देशभर में पटाखों के निर्माण-बिक्री पर प्रतिबंध की मांग वाली एक याचिका पर पटाखा निर्माताओं से कहा कि खुशियां मनाने की आड़ में उन्हें लोगों की जान से खिलवाड़ की अनुमति नहीं दी जा सकती है। हालांकि कोर्ट ने ग्रीन पटाखों की अनुमति देते हुए कहा कि पटाखों पर प्रतिबंध किसी समुदाय/समूह के खिलाफ नहीं है।रेल मंत्रालय ने आईआरसीटीसी से ई-टिकटिंग पर उसे मिलने वाले सर्विस चार्ज का 50% हिस्सा देने को कहा है। आईआरसीटीसी 1 नवंबर 2021 से कंविनिएंस फीस का आधा हिस्सा सरकार को देना शुरू करेगी। विशेषज्ञों का मानना है कि इससे भविष्य में आईआरसीटीसी का राजस्व प्रभावित हो सकता है क्योंकि आईआरसीटीसी के राजस्व का बड़ा हिस्सा ई-टिकटिंग से आता है।दिल्ली हाईकोर्ट ने क्रिप्टो एक्सचेंज में यूपीआई भुगतान को प्रतिबंधित करने के फैसले को वापस लेने की मांग वाली याचिका पर गुरुवार को आरबीआई, एसबीआई, एनपीसीआई व अन्य को नोटिस जारी किया। याचिका में आरोप लगाया गया है कि वज़ीरएक्स यूज़र्स के लिए यूपीआई सेवाओं को रोकने का एसबीआई का फैसला सुप्रीम कोर्ट के एक फैसले के खिलाफ है।केंद्रीय जांच ब्यूरो (सीबीआई) ने दिल्ली पुलिस के एक सब-इंस्पेक्टर (एसआई) को रिश्वत लेने के मामले में गिरफ्तार कर उसके पास से ₹1.12 करोड़ की नकदी बरामद की है। बकौल सीबीआई, एक शिकायत में आरोप लगाया गया था कि एसआई ने शिकायतकर्ता से ₹5 लाख की रिश्वत मांगी थी जिसके बाद एसआई को रिश्वत लेते रंगे हाथ पकड़ा गया।राष्ट्रीय खेल पुरस्कारों की चयन समिति ने अर्जुन पुरस्कार के लिए गौतमबुद्ध नगर (यूपी) के ज़िलाधिकारी व बैडमिंटन खिलाड़ी सुहास एल.वाई. के नाम की सिफारिश की है। सुहास ने कहा, "मुझे इतना प्यार व स्नेह देने के लिए देशवासियों का शुक्रिया अदा करता हूं।" गौरतलब है, सुहास ने टोक्यो पैरालंपिक्स में पुरुषों की एसएल4 श्रेणी में रजत पदक जीता था। क्रिकेट मैच में भारत पर पाकिस्तान की जीत का जश्न मनाने के आरोप में आगरा (उत्तर प्रदेश) में 3 कश्मीरी छात्रों की गिरफ्तारी को पीडीपी प्रमुख महबूबा मुफ्ती ने निंदनीय कार्रवाई बताया है। उन्होंने कहा, "2 साल के दमन के बाद कश्मीर की स्थिति देखकर केंद्र की आंख खुल जानी चाहिए थी।" उन्होंने छात्रों की रिहाई की मांग की है।ठाणे (महाराष्ट्र) की एक अदालत ने ज़बरन वसूली के मामले में मुंबई के पूर्व पुलिस कमिश्नर परम बीर सिंह के खिलाफ गैर-ज़मानती वॉरंट जारी किया है। इससे पहले, पुलिस ने सिंह के घर के बाहर नोटिस चस्पा कर पूछताछ के लिए 9-अक्टूबर को बुलाया था लेकिन वह पेश नहीं हुए। बकौल रिपोर्ट्स, सिंह पर महाराष्ट्र में 5 एफआईआर दर्ज हैं।टी20 विश्व कप 2021 में भारत के खिलाफ पाकिस्तान की जीत का जश्न मनाने के आरोप में राजौरी (जम्मू-कश्मीर) के सरकारी मेडिकल कॉलेज की एक सरकारी महिला कर्मचारी को बर्खास्त किया गया है। इससे पहले पुलिस ने जीत पर जश्न मनाने को लेकर शेर-ए-कश्मीर इंस्टीट्यूट ऑफ मेडिकल साइंसेज़ (श्रीनगर) के छात्रों के खिलाफ यूएपीए के तहत मामला दर्ज किया था।मुंबई (महाराष्ट्र) में 19-वर्षीय कथित रेप पीड़िता और उसकी मां समेत 5 लोग रेप के आरोपी की पत्नी से जबरन वसूली के मामले में गिरफ्तार हुए हैं। बकौल पुलिस, शख्स की पत्नी से एक महिला ने केस वापस लेने के लिए ₹14 लाख मांगे थे। इसके बाद शख्स की पत्नी की शिकायत पर पुलिस ने जाल बिछाकर उन्हें पकड़ लिया।नौसेना प्रमुख एडमिरल करमबीर सिंह ने बुधवार को कहा कि कुछ देश 'भू-केंद्रित क्षेत्रीय मानसिकता' अपनाकर हिंद-प्रशांत क्षेत्र में अधिक नियंत्रण हासिल करने के प्रयास में हैं। बकौल सिंह, समुद्री हिंद-प्रशांत के वैश्विक नियमों को चुनौती दी जा रही है। उन्होंने इस क्षेत्र को भू-राजनीति और अर्थव्यवस्था का केंद्र बताते हुए कहा कि यहां प्रतिस्पर्धा में विविधता आ रही है।
author: रौनक राज रौनक राज रौनक राज रौनक राज वेद प्रकाश शर्मावेद प्रकाश शर्माअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारनूतन कुमार गुप्तानूतन कुमार गुप्तानूतन कुमार गुप्तानूतन कुमार गुप्ताGunjan GoswamiGunjan Goswamiवेद प्रकाश शर्मावेद प्रकाश शर्माशुभम गुप्ताशुभम गुप्ताGunjan GoswamiGunjan GoswamiGunjan GoswamiGunjan GoswamiGunjan GoswamiGunjan GoswamiGunjan GoswamiGunjan Goswamiअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारशुभम गुप्ताशुभम गुप्ताshashank mishrashashank mishraजय शंकर ठाकुरजय शंकर ठाकुरshashank mishrashashank mishraअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारshashank mishrashashank mishraअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारजय शंकर ठाकुरजय शंकर ठाकुर

title: Cannabis worth ₹2 crore seized in Andhra Pradesh; 2 arrested | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Andhra Pradesh Police has seized cannabis worth ₹2 crore in Chintoor area of ​​East Godavari district and arrested two persons. Police said the contraband was being smuggled from Visakhapatnam to Hyderabad. The police has also seized ₹2,000 cash, three mobile phones, a van and a car, the Assistant Superintendent of Police said.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Aryan jailed for 25 days for something he never did: Sanjay Gupta | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Filmmaker Sanjay Gupta took to Twitter to say that he is very upset with a system that kept a young man behind bars for more than 25 days for something he never did. He tweeted after Aryan Khan was granted bail in the Mumbai cruise drugs case. "This has to change! God bless you and stay strong, Aryan," Sanjay wrote.
author: Kriti KambiriKriti Kambiri

title: Centre releases balance amount of Rs 44,000 cr to states, UTs under back-to-back loan facility in-lieu of GST compensation
content: ANI | Updated: Oct 28, 2021 17:18  ISTNew Delhi [India], October 28 (ANI): The Ministry of Finance on Thursday released Rs 44,000 crore to the states and union territories with legislature under the back-to-back loan facility in lieu of GST compensation.As per an official release, after taking into account the earlier release of Rs 1,15,000 crore (Rs 75,000 crore released on July 15, 2021, and Rs 40,000 crore released on October 7, 2021), the total amount released in the current financial year as a back-to-back loan in-lieu of GST compensation is Rs 1,59,000 crore. This release is in addition to normal GST compensation being released every two months out of actual cess collection.Subsequent to the 43rd GST council meeting held on May 28, 2021, it was decided that the central government would borrow Rs 1.59 lakh crore and release it to states and union territories with the legislature on a back-to-back basis to meet the resource gap due to the short release of compensation on account of the inadequate amount in the compensation fund.This amount is as per the principles adopted for a similar facility in Financial Year 2020-2021, where an amount of Rs 1.10 lakh crore was released to states under a similar arrangement. This amount of Rs 1.59 lakh crore would be over and above the compensation in excess of Rs 1 lakh crore (based on cess collection) that is estimated to be released to states, union territories with legislature during this financial year. The sum total of Rs 2.59 lakh crore is expected to exceed the amount of GST compensation accruing in FY 2021-2022.All eligible states and UTs (with Legislature) have agreed to the arrangements of funding of the compensation shortfall under the back-to-back loan facility. For effective response and management of COVID-19 pandemic and a step-up in capital expenditure, all states and union territories have a very important role to play. For assisting the states/UTs in their endeavour, the Ministry of Finance has frontloaded the release of assistance under the back-to-back loan facility during FY 2021-22 of Rs 1,59,000 crore.The release of Rs 44,000 crore being made now is funded from borrowings of government in five-year securities issued in the current financial year, at a Weighted Average Yield of 5.69 per cent. No additional market borrowing by the central government is envisaged on account of this release.It is expected that this release will help the states, union territories in planning their public expenditure among other things, for improving, health infrastructure and taking up infrastructure projects. (ANI)GOI in-lieu GST compensation Ministry of Finance   Telangana HC upholds EC decision on deferring Dalita Bandhu scheme in Huzurabad constituencyUpdated: Oct 29, 2021 00:20 ISTKarnataka HC grants bail to Bineesh Kodiyeri in money laundering caseUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:44 ISTGovt will try to create hurdles in probe of Pegasus spyware case, alleges CPI MPUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:44 IST'Satyameva Jayate' says Aryan Khan's legal team after Bombay HC granted him bail in drugs-on-cruise caseUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:31 ISTEC removes Bihar DSP ahead bypolls following RJD's complaintUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:27 IST"To be in jail is traumatic", says Arbaaz Merchant's father after son granted bail in drugs-on-cruise caseUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:26 ISTUP Polls 2022: Owaisi in talks with Shivpal Yadav, Chandra Shekhar Azad for alliance copyrights © aninews.in | All rights Reserved

title: Wankhede's wife writes to Uddhav, says 'a woman's dignity is being toyed with' | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: NCB officer Sameer Wankhede's wife and actress Kranti Redkar has written a letter to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray over "attack on her family and her personal life". She wrote, "We're being insulted before people every day. A woman's dignity is being toyed with in Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's state." She added, "Had Balasaheb been here today, he wouldn't have liked it."
author: Apaar SharmaApaar Sharma

title: Dalits will never support Lalu, RJD: Ex-Bihar CM Jitan Ram Manjhi | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Scheduled Castes and Dalits in Bihar would never support Lalu Prasad Yadav and his party Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD), former CM Jitan Ram Manjhi said. "Nitish Kumar has respected Scheduled Castes and Lalu Prasad Yadav has insulted them...There is no chance of joining them," he added. This comes ahead of the state Assembly bypolls in Tarapur and Kusheshwar Asthan.
author: Atul MishraAtul Mishra

title: UP govt to identify, promote a special product in each district: CM Yogi | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has said the state government will identify and promote special products, like locks of Aligarh and papad of Hapur, in every district. Yogi said, "[UP government has]...decided to encourage industries to produce such items...and generate employment in...district itself." In the past four years, the UP government has built 43 lakh houses for UP people, he added.
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

title: AAP's North East Delhi Councillor Sahista joins Congress | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Aam Aadmi Party Councillor Sahista joined the Congress in the presence of Delhi Congress chief Anil Kumar on Wednesday. She said AAP workers and elected leaders feel suffocated with the "one-man show" in the party. Sahista, who represents the Sri Ram Colony ward in North East Delhi, joined the Congress along with her supporters.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Will reveal my new party's name, symbol once EC approves them: Amarinder Singh | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Wednesday said that he will reveal his new party's name once the Election Commission approves it. "We have made a request for a symbol also," he added. Singh further said that the new party will contest on all the 117 Assembly seats in Punjab in the Assembly elections in the state in 2022.
author: Atul MishraAtul Mishra

title: Rizwan offering namaz on ground surrounded by Hindus was very special: Waqar Younis | Sports News | Inshorts
news_articles: After Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Mohammad Rizwan offered namaz on ground during T20 World Cup match against India, ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis said, "Rizwan offering namaz surrounded by Hindus was very special." Reacting to it, Harsha Bhogle said, "I'm sure there will be an apology on the way from Waqar. We need to unite the cricket world, not divide it by religion."
author: Anmol SharmaAnmol Sharma

title: 'Who all here drink?' asks Rahul as he questions Cong's alcohol abstention rule at meet | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: During a Congress meeting, Rahul Gandhi questioned how relevant are the party's rules like wearing khadi and not consuming alcohol to become a member of Congress. "How many of these rules are followed today? How many people in this room drink alcohol," Rahul asked. Two general secretaries admitted that they drink alcohol, according to reports.
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

title: It seems unreal: Adarsh on working with Meryl, Kit in Extrapolations | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Adarsh Gourav has started shooting for 'Extrapolations', an eight interconnected episodic series, in New York. Speaking about working on his second international project, 'The White Tiger' actor said, "It seems unreal. To be in the same anthology as actors...like Meryl Streep, Kit Harington, Sienna Miller." Adarsh further said working on 'Extrapolations' has been "highly educational".

title: Celebrations over Pak win against India meant to provoke BJP: Farooq | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah has said that celebrations in J&K over Pakistan's win against India in T20 World Cup 2021 were meant to provoke the BJP. Abdullah said those who celebrated the win were young boys, adding, "They don't have anything to do with [Pakistanis]." He added a volcano has been building up in J&K after Article 370's abrogation.

title: Those who abused Lord Ram now visiting Ayodhya: UP CM Yogi | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's recent visit to Ayodhya, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said those who earlier abused Lord Ram are now visiting Ayodhya as elections are approaching. Yogi further accused Kejriwal of forcing UP's migrants out of Delhi during COVID-19 lockdown. "[Who] couldn't handle UP people in Delhi is positioning himself as one who could handle all...UP," Yogi added.
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

title: Rahul Gandhi questions feasibility of clause on alcohol abstention, khadi use for party membership
content: ANI | Updated: Oct 26, 2021 20:40  ISTBy Siddharth SharmaNew Delhi [India], October 26 (ANI): Even as the Congress party is going to start a membership drive from November 1, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi questioned how relevant are the rules for becoming a member according to the party constitution such as wearing Khadi and not consuming alcohol.Speaking in the meeting held by Congress president Sonia Gandhi today, Rahul asked, "How many of these rules are followed today? How many people in this room drink alcohol?"Responding to Rahul's question, only two general secretaries admitted that they drink alcohol. Along with this, a discussion also arose over the liquor rule to become a member of the party.According to the party constitution, a person who wants to become a member of the Congress party should not drink and should be accustomed to wearing Khadi.Punjab Congress president Navjot Singh Sidhu who was also present in the meeting said that most of the people in this state drink alcohol, sources said. "Sidhu asked how will the rule of Congress membership be followed in this situation?" sources said.Other leaders also started expressing their opinion on the issue and the organisation general secretary KC Venugopal sought to put an end to the discussion.After the liquor rule, the meeting started discussions on the Khadi rule and Rahul Gandhi asked how practical it was. The leaders also said that Khadi had special importance at the time of freedom, but at present, it has become expensive.Following the discussion over the rules, a leader also suggested changing the rules of membership in the meeting of the Congress Working Committee. However, the proposal to change the rules could not be made in the meeting today.Earlier today, Congress president Sonia Gandhi held a meeting of the party general secretaries, in-charges and state presidents on the issue of membership campaign, the movement against inflation and assembly elections.In the meeting, the party president gave a message to all the party leaders to fight the RSS-BJP ideology by creating discipline and solidarity, sources said. How many people in this room drink alcohol?"Responding to Rahul's question, only two general secretaries admitted that they drink alcohol. Along with this, a discussion also arose over the liquor rule to become a member of the party.According to the party constitution, a person who wants to become a member of the Congress party should not drink and should be accustomed to wearing Khadi.  Punjab Congress president Navjot Singh Sidhu who was also present in the meeting said that most of the people in this state drink alcohol, sources said. "Sidhu asked how will the rule of Congress membership be followed in this situation?" sources said.Other leaders also started expressing their opinion on the issue and the organisation general secretary KC Venugopal sought to put an end to the discussion.After the liquor rule, the meeting started discussions on the Khadi rule and Rahul Gandhi asked how practical it was. The leaders also said that Khadi had special importance at the time of freedom, but at present, it has become expensive.Following the discussion over the rules, a leader also suggested changing the rules of membership in the meeting of the Congress Working Committee. However, the proposal to change the rules could not be made in the meeting today.Earlier today, Congress president Sonia Gandhi held a meeting of the party general secretaries, in-charges and state presidents on the issue of membership campaign, the movement against inflation and assembly elections.In the meeting, the party president gave a message to all the party leaders to fight the RSS-BJP ideology by creating discipline and solidarity, sources said. (ANI)

title: BJP not going anywhere for many decades, Rahul doesn't realise: Prashant | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor said BJP is going to be the centre of Indian polity and it's not going anywhere for many decades. He said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi doesn't realise this. "That's where the problem lies with Rahul probably. He thinks it's just a matter of time that people will throw [PM Modi] away. That's not happening," Kishor added.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Sonia calls Lalu Prasad Yadav amid rift in Bihar Mahagathbandhan | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Amid reports of a rift within the Mahagathbandhan in Bihar, Congress President Sonia Gandhi called RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav on Tuesday. He said that Sonia enquired about his health. "I told her that Congress is an all India party and she should get all like-minded people and parties together to form a strong alternative [to BJP]," Lalu said.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: CBI files interim chargesheet against 4 in ex-Andhra MP's murder case | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed an interim chargesheet against four accused in the murder case of former Andhra Pradesh MP YS Vivekananda Reddy. He was found brutally murdered at his residence in Pulivendula in March 2019 ahead of the general elections. The case was probed by the Andhra Pradesh Police and other agencies for around 18 months.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Swaroop was my boss' daughter, told friend I'll marry her: Paresh | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Paresh Rawal revealed that he once told a friend that he will marry his now-wife Swaroop Rawal. His friend said that she was his boss' daughter, but Paresh said he'll still marry her. "After 2-3 months, I told her, 'I want to marry you but don't [say] 'Let's get to know each other, let's grow together'...Commit yourself'," the actor said.
author: Kriti KambiriKriti Kambiri

title: BJP's Anila Singh says Upendra Tiwari's statements should not be viewed from political prism
content: ANI | Updated: Oct 27, 2021 15:02  ISTNew Delhi [India], October 27 (ANI): UP Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader and spokesperson Anila Singh said on Wednesday that the state minister Upendra Tiwari's statements describing Prime Minister Narendra Modi as an "incarnation of god' should not be viewed through a political prism. "I think Upendra's statements should not be viewed from a political prism. He was perhaps explaining the feelings of people and women who now have their own gas connections, houses, toilets, bank accounts and whose children are getting a good education. There are hundreds of social schemes by the Prime Minister that have benefitted a lot of people so for that person Modiji is equivalent to god. If someone does something really great to me, they would be like a god to me. But that does not mean they are a God." said Singh. Uttar Pradesh Panchayati Raj Minister Upendra Tiwari on Tuesday had hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi and said that the latter is no ordinary person adding that he is an "incarnation of the Almighty.""Narendra Bhai Modi is no ordinary person. He is an incarnation of the Almighty," Tiwari said while addressing a gathering in Hardoi.Commenting on Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's visit to Ayodhya ahead of assembly polls in the state next year, she said, "The elections are going on so they (Aam Aadmi Party) want to project him as a prominent Hindu face. The whole credit goes to BJP for this, other parties have realised that appeasement politics is not going to work. If you have to be secular, be secular for everyone. You cannot target the Hindu population in Hindustan. BJP believes in 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas'. This is what we have done and will keep doing."Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday offered prayers to Ram Lalla at the Ram Janmabhoomi site in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya.Kejriwal's visit to Ayodhya comes just months before the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections to be held in 2022. Notably, AAP will also contest the elections in the state.Meanwhile, Kerjriwal today in Delhi announced that the Cabinet has approved the addition of Ayodhya in its Tirth Yatra Yojana, a free pilgrimage scheme for senior citizens of the national capital.Addressing media personnel here, Kejriwal said, "Mukhya Mantri Teerth Yatra Yojana which was halted due to COVID will probably be resumed within a month."(ANI)Anila Singh Upendra Tiwari Narendra Modi Arvind KejriwalEducation dept can play paramount role in spreading awareness for voter registration: Chief Electoral Officer of DelhiUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 22:15 ISTDemands of Lakhbir's family justified, Punjab govt should give them compensation, job: Tarun ChughUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 22:03 ISTWill not let farmers die by suicide from April 1, says Delhi CM at Punjab's Mansa Updated: Oct 28, 2021 21:33 ISTRole of ministries, agencies involved in coastal security to be strengthened soon after meeting with PM ModiUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 20:18 ISTBecoming part of conspiracy also punishable under same section of law,  NCB lawyer tells Bombay HC in drugs-on-cruise caseUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 19:22 ISTRajyavardhan Singh Rathore slams Congress on internet shutdown in Rajasthan Updated: Oct 28, 2021 18:58 ISTPM Modi to visit Kedarnath on Nov 5copyrights © aninews.in | All rights Reserved
