If someone does something really great to me, they would be like a god to me. But that does not mean they are a God." said Singh. Uttar Pradesh Panchayati Raj Minister Upendra Tiwari on Tuesday had hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi and said that the latter is no ordinary person adding that he is an "incarnation of the Almighty.""Narendra Bhai Modi is no ordinary person. He is an incarnation of the Almighty," Tiwari said while addressing a gathering in Hardoi.Commenting on Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's visit to Ayodhya ahead of assembly polls in the state next year, she said, "The elections are going on so they (Aam Aadmi Party) want to project him as a prominent Hindu face. The whole credit goes to BJP for this, other parties have realised that appeasement politics is not going to work. If you have to be secular, be secular for everyone. You cannot target the Hindu population in Hindustan. BJP believes in 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas'. This is what we have done and will keep doing."Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday offered prayers to Ram Lalla at the Ram Janmabhoomi site in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya.Kejriwal's visit to Ayodhya comes just months before the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections to be held in 2022. Notably, AAP will also contest the elections in the state.Meanwhile, Kerjriwal today in Delhi announced that the Cabinet has approved the addition of Ayodhya in its Tirth Yatra Yojana, a free pilgrimage scheme for senior citizens of the national capital.Addressing media personnel here, Kejriwal said, "Mukhya Mantri Teerth Yatra Yojana which was halted due to COVID will probably be resumed within a month."(ANI)
category: BJP's Anila Singh says Upendra Tiwari's statements should not be viewed from political prism

title: Adani Ports scraps plans to build container terminal in Myanmar | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Adani Ports on Wednesday said it was abandoning plans to build a container terminal in Myanmar. The decision was taken after a review of the situation, including exploring any divestment opportunities, it added. In May, the firm had said that it would abandon the project and write down the investment if found to be in violation of US sanctions.
author: Krishna RajKrishna Raj

title: I'm so overwhelmed: B Praak on winning National Award | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Singer B Praak, speaking about winning the National Award for Best Male Playback Singer for his song 'Teri Mitti', said, "I'm so overwhelmed." "It has been a year full of things to be grateful for. But of all the highlights, this award shines brightest," he added. "There cannot be a greater honour than the National Award," said B Praak.
author: Udit GuptaUdit Gupta

title: BJP giving money in Sindgi, Hangal bypoll constituencies: Siddaramaiah | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Wednesday alleged that BJP is distributing money in the Sindgi and the Hangal constituencies in Karnataka. "Ten to 12 ministers in each constituency are holding a bag of money to distribute it to people to purchase votes. This doesn't work," he stated. Siddaramaiah added that Congress will file a complaint with the election commission officials.
author: Jigyasu JoshiJigyasu Joshi

title: 73,512 people vaccinated in last 24 hrs in Delhi; 38 COVID-19 cases reported | Coronavirus News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Delhi State Health Bulletin on Wednesday informed that 73,512 beneficiaries were administered the COVID-19 vaccine in the last 24 hours and 38 new cases were reported in the city. The national capital also reported zero COVID-19-related deaths, the bulletin stated. The positivity rate in Delhi currently stands at 0.06% and there are 348 active coronavirus cases.
author: Jigyasu JoshiJigyasu Joshi

title: Canada launches pilot programme to accept refugees from N Korea | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: A Toronto-based human rights organisation, HanVoice, in partnership with the Canadian government is launching a private sponsorship programme to resettle North Korean refugees in Canada. The programme aims to bring five North Korean refugee families from Thailand to Canada within the next two years. Canada will become the third country after South Korea and the US to accept North Koreans.
author: ShaileshShailesh

title: Storm leaves 6L US homes without power; NWS calls 'situation dangerous' | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: More than 6,00,000 homes were left without electricity in the northeastern US as a powerful coastal storm hit the region on Wednesday, forecasters said. Nearly 4,70,000 homes in Massachusetts and 91,000 in Rhode Island faced the power outage due to the storm. Calling the situation dangerous, the National Weather Service warned of hurricane-type gusts of wind and many uprooted trees.
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

title: Maha CM to write to PM over Bollywood's portrayal in bad light: Malik | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik on Tuesday said CM Uddhav Thackeray has informed him that he is concerned about the portrayal of Bollywood in such a "negative" way. "He (CM) is going to write a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding this," Malik said. The drug haul cases have maligned the image of the film industry, he added.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Beautiful start to my new beginning: Kamya Panjabi on joining Congress | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Actress Kamya Panjabi, who joined the Congress party in the presence of Mumbai Congress President Bhai Jagtap, took to Instagram to share the news. Sharing a post, she wrote, "Beautiful start to my new beginning! Thank you...@bhaijagtapofficial bhai @tehseenpoonawala @incmumbai for such a warm welcome...looking forward to start working under the leadership of @rahulgandhi @priyankagandhivadra."
author: Mahima KharbandaMahima Kharbanda

title: 41 pregnant women in Kerala died due to COVID-19 so far: State Health Min | Coronavirus News | Inshorts
news_articles: As many as 41 pregnant women have so far succumbed to coronavirus infection in Kerala since the pandemic started, Health Minister Veena George said on Wednesday. "Besides, 149 patients affected with the viral infection have died by suicide," George told the state Assembly. A total of 29,977 people in Kerala have died due to COVID-19 as per the Health Department.
author: Jigyasu JoshiJigyasu Joshi

title: SC allows Centre's appeal against giving Airtel ₹923 cr as GST refund | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Supreme Court has allowed the Centre's appeal against the Delhi High Court's order, which permitted Bharti Airtel to claim a GST refund of ₹923 crore. The High Court had allowed Bharti Airtel to rectify its GST returns from July to September 2017 and claim the refund. The High Court had also directed Centre to verify the excess GST claim.
author: Krishna RajKrishna Raj

title: Eternals' B'wood dance scene shows love for pop culture: Director | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Marvels' 'Eternals' director Chloe Zhao has said that the Bollywood dance scene in the film shows the love for pop culture, showmanship, cinema and storytelling. The character Kingo, portrayed by Kumail Nanjiani, is a Bollywood actor in the film. Chloe added that the character was originally set in Hollywood, but was later changed to Bollywood to include the dance number.
author: Kriti KambiriKriti Kambiri

title: BJP distributing money in Sindhagi, Hanagal by-poll constituencies, alleges Siddaramaiah
content: ANI | Updated: Oct 27, 2021 20:00  ISTHubli (Karnataka) [India], October 27 (ANI): Former Karnataka Chief Minister and Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Wednesday alleged that the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) is distributing money in the Sindhagi and the Hanagal constituencies of the state."Ten to twelve ministers in each constituency are holding a bag of money to distribute it to people to purchase votes. This doesn't work," he stated.The leader also said that Congress will file a complaint with the election commission officials on the basis of the video.Meanwhile, bypolls on Sindhagi and Hanagal constituencies in Karnataka are scheduled to be held on October 30. (ANI)Congress Siddaramaiah BJP by poll KarnatakaKarnataka HC grants bail to Bineesh Kodiyeri in money laundering caseUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:31 ISTEC removes Bihar DSP ahead bypolls following RJD's complaintUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:29 ISTCentre playing T-20 match on petrol, diesel prices; scores 'century plus', people's savings 'clean bowled': CongressUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:12 ISTK'taka HC restrains state police from taking action against Dream11 app foundersUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 22:56 ISTAnybody contesting elections in Goa will not affect BJP's standing in state: Pramod SawantUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 22:30 ISTMan attacked outside Delhi High CourtUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 22:15 ISTDemands of Lakhbir's family justified, Punjab govt should give them compensation, job: Tarun Chughcopyrights © aninews.in | All rights Reserved
news_articles: Hubli (Karnataka) [India], October 27 (ANI): Former Karnataka Chief Minister and Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Wednesday alleged that the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) is distributing money in the Sindhagi and the Hanagal constituencies of the state.  "Ten to twelve ministers in each constituency are holding a bag of money to distribute it to people to purchase votes. This doesn't work," he stated.The leader also said that Congress will file a complaint with the election commission officials on the basis of the video.Meanwhile, bypolls on Sindhagi and Hanagal constituencies in Karnataka are scheduled to be held on October 30. (ANI)
category: BJP distributing money in Sindhagi, Hanagal by-poll constituencies, alleges Siddaramaiah

title: Mufti's DNA is defective: Anil Vij on her tweet on India-Pak match | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Haryana Minister Anil Vij on Tuesday said, "Mehbooba Mufti's DNA is defective, she has to prove how much of an Indian she is." His remarks come after the Peoples Democratic Party chief raised questions over criticism of those celebrating Pakistan's win against India in the T20 World Cup. "Why such anger against Kashmiris for celebrating Pakistan's win?" Mufti had tweeted.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Clear Air India dues, purchase tickets in cash: Govt to ministries | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Department of Expenditure, which comes under the Finance Ministry, on Wednesday asked all ministries and departments to clear dues of Air India and purchase tickets by making cash payments. Since the disinvestment process of Air India has started, the airline has stopped extending credit limit, it said. Earlier, the government sold Air India to Tata Sons for ₹18,000 crore.
author: Shalini OjhaShalini Ojha

title: UP govt to identify, promote a special product in each district: CM Adityanath
content: ANI | Updated: Oct 26, 2021 15:33  ISTLucknow (Uttar Pradesh) [India], October 26 (ANI): The Uttar Pradesh government has identified and will promote special products in every district and will encourage the setting up of industries to create job opportunities for the youth.In his address at an event of the OBC summit organised by the BJP, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said, "The state government has identified and will promote products like locks of Aligarh, papad of Hapur, knives of Rampur, and bangles of Bareilly. The BJP government in the state decided to encourage industries to produce such items in large quantity and generate employment in the district itself. The BJP government has always cared about its people whereas the previous governments never worked for its citizens."Referring to former chief minister Kalyan Singh, Adityanath said, "Kalyan Singh had always worked for the marginalized and backward class people. Drawing inspiration from him, the BJP MLAs and volunteers helped every citizen of the state during the COVID-19 period while the leaders from the other political parties were 'home quarantined'.He said that in the past four years, the UP government has built 43 lakh houses for the people of the state and 2 crore toilets. (ANI)UP CM Yogi Adityanath Uttar Pradesh Lucknow OBC summit BJPCentre playing T-20 match on petrol, diesel prices; scores 'century plus', people's savings 'clean bowled': CongressUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:26 ISTUP Polls 2022: Owaisi in talks with Shivpal Yadav, Chandra Shekhar Azad for alliance Updated: Oct 28, 2021 22:56 ISTAnybody contesting elections in Goa will not affect BJP's standing in state: Pramod SawantUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 22:36 ISTITBP recovers 3 bodies of trekkers who died after heavy snowfall in HP's Kinnaur Updated: Oct 28, 2021 22:15 ISTDemands of Lakhbir's family justified, Punjab govt should give them compensation, job: Tarun ChughUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 22:03 ISTWill not let farmers die by suicide from April 1, says Delhi CM at Punjab's Mansa Updated: Oct 28, 2021 21:45 ISTHC slams UP police for arresting people from national capital without informing Delhi Policecopyrights © aninews.in | All rights Reserved
news_articles: Lucknow (Uttar Pradesh) [India], October 26 (ANI): The Uttar Pradesh government has identified and will promote special products in every district and will encourage the setting up of industries to create job opportunities for the youth.  In his address at an event of the OBC summit organised by the BJP, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said, "The state government has identified and will promote products like locks of Aligarh, papad of Hapur, knives of Rampur, and bangles of Bareilly. The BJP government in the state decided to encourage industries to produce such items in large quantity and generate employment in the district itself. The BJP government has always cared about its people whereas the previous governments never worked for its citizens."Referring to former chief minister Kalyan Singh, Adityanath said, "Kalyan Singh had always worked for the marginalized and backward class people. Drawing inspiration from him, the BJP MLAs and volunteers helped every citizen of the state during the COVID-19 period while the leaders from the other political parties were 'home quarantined'.He said that in the past four years, the UP government has built 43 lakh houses for the people of the state and 2 crore toilets. (ANI)
category: UP govt to identify, promote a special product in each district: CM Adityanath

title: Former BJP MLA Krishna Kalyani joins Trinamool Congress in West Bengal | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: MLA Krishna Kalyani, who resigned from BJP earlier this month, joined TMC on Wednesday. Kalyani quit BJP a day after he was sent a show-cause notice by the party for speaking against Raiganj MP Debasree Chaudhuri. "Inspired by the huge mandate that people of Bengal bestowed upon Mamata Banerjee, he has decided to reject BJP and their propaganda," TMC tweeted.
author: Jigyasu JoshiJigyasu Joshi

title: 90 persons jailed for drunk driving in Telangana's Cyberabad in 3 days | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: As many as 90 persons, who were caught by the Cyberabad Traffic Police in Telangana's Hyderabad between October 20 and 23, have been jailed on charges of drunk driving. The 90 persons, who were sentenced to jail for durations ranging from one day to seven days, were among 262 persons caught for drunk driving or driving without a licence.
author: Atul MishraAtul Mishra

title: PM Modi isn't ordinary, he's an incarnation of Almighty: UP minister | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: UP minister Upendra Tiwari on Tuesday said PM Narendra Modi is not an ordinary man, but an incarnation of Almighty. Commenting on his remarks, UP BJP spokesperson Anila Singh said his words shouldn't be viewed through a political prism. "There're hundreds of social schemes...that...benefitted a lot of people so for that person Modi Ji is equivalent to God," she said.
author: Shalini OjhaShalini Ojha

title: Kejriwal to meet farmers, businessmen during 2-day visit to Punjab | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal will be on a two-day visit to poll-bound Punjab from Thursday. Kejriwal, the Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor, will meet farmers in the Mansa area of the state on the first day of his visit. On Friday, he will go to Bathinda and meet businessmen there.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Nitish Kumar is the most arrogant person in the country: Lalu | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav has said that Bihar CM "Nitish Kumar is the most arrogant person in the country". Lalu said, "[Once Nitish's] dream of becoming [PM]...broke down, he sat in the lap of BJP and formed the government in Bihar." It comes after Nitish said he doesn't pay any attention to Lalu, who "only talks but doesn't deliver".
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

title: England chase down 125-run target in 85 balls in their 1st ever T20I match vs B'desh | Sports News | Inshorts
news_articles: England chased down a target of 125 runs in just 85 deliveries against Bangladesh to win their second consecutive match at the T20 World Cup 2021. This was the first time ever that England and Bangladesh were playing a T20I against each other in men's cricket. England opener Jason Roy was named Man of the Match for scoring 61(38).
author: Anmol SharmaAnmol Sharma

title: They have no credibility: Richa on celebrities attending TV debates | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Actress Richa Chadha spoke about Bollywood celebrities who try to make themselves relevant by participating in film industry-related debates on news channels. She said these people have "no credibility" and are "very opportunistic". She added, "I don't want to name them...and give them...importance because that's actually what they thrive on." "They are the rejects of the system," Richa said.
author: Mahima KharbandaMahima Kharbanda

title: PM is not above the nation: Rahul after SC's decision on Pegasus issue | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to order an independent probe into the Pegasus issue and claimed that only the PM or Home Minister can give approval for it. "Even if this data was on PM's desk, then that too is totally criminal," he further said, adding "The Prime Minister is not above the nation".
author: Jigyasu JoshiJigyasu Joshi

title: J&K Police team reaches Gogra to rescue nomads stuck due to snowfall | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: A police team from Jammu and Kashmir's Reasi district has visited the Gogra region to rescue nomads stranded there due to heavy snowfall. Two people were reported missing after heavy snowfall in the area. On Sunday, two people were killed, while two others were rescued after they were trapped in snowfall in Anantnag district.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: 9 convicted in case over serial blasts in 2013 at then PM candidate Modi's rally | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: Nine out of the 10 accused have been convicted in the case over serial blasts at then PM candidate Narendra Modi's rally in 2013 at Gandhi Maidan in Bihar's Patna. One accused has been acquitted by the NIA Court Patna in the absence of evidence. The blasts occurred during the 'Hunkar' rally.
author: Ankush VermaAnkush Verma

title: Rahul welcomes Supreme Court's decision on Pegasus snooping issue | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to form a three-member panel of cyber experts to probe the alleged use of Pegasus for surveillance. He said snooping using Pegasus is an attempt to crush Indian democracy. "I am confident that we will get the truth out of this," Rahul added.
author: Deepika BhattDeepika Bhatt

title: Bharat Bhakti Akhara to vet movies before their release: Pragya Thakur | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur said the Bharat Bhakti Akhara, which she founded in 2019, will vet the movies before their release. "We will make a body that will go through the scripts and the contents. If it's objectionable, we won't allow its release," she added. This comes after Bajrang Dal members vandalised the sets of the web series 'Aashram'.
author: Jigyasu JoshiJigyasu Joshi

title: Political News: Government Politics News in Hindi with Inshorts
news_articles: टीवी ऐक्ट्रेस काम्या पंजाबी बुधवार को महाराष्ट्र में मुंबई कांग्रेस के अध्यक्ष भाई जगताप की उपस्थिति में कांग्रेस पार्टी में शामिल हो गईं। रिपोर्ट्स के अनुसार, काम्या अपने काम और व्यस्तता के कारण पहले राजनीति में नहीं जा सकीं लेकिन 'शक्ति- अस्तित्व के एहसास की' शो बंद हो जाने के बाद उन्होंने राजनीति में आने का फैसला किया।चुनावी रणनीतिकार प्रशांत किशोर ने कहा है, "बीजेपी हारे या जीते, अब वह भारतीय राजनीति के केंद्र में रहेगी जैसे 40 वर्ष तक कांग्रेस रही थी।" उन्होंने कहा, "संभव है जनता प्रधानमंत्री नरेंद्र मोदी को हटा दे लेकिन बीजेपी कहीं नहीं जाएगी। इसके लिए दशकों संघर्ष करना होगा।" बकौल किशोर, कांग्रेस नेता राहुल गांधी यही बात नहीं समझते हैं।केंद्रीय मंत्री रामदास अठावले ने कहा, "देश में शराब पीने वालों को जेल नहीं भेजा जाता लेकिन कानून में ड्रग्स का सेवन करने वालों को जेल भेजने का एक प्रावधान है।" उन्होंने कहा, "हमारे मंत्रालय को लगता है कि ड्रग्स का सेवन करने वालों को जेल नहीं बल्कि सुधार गृह भेजा जाना चाहिए...कानून को बदलने की ज़रूरत है।"एनसीबी अधिकारी समीर वानखेड़े की बहन यास्मीन वानखेड़े ने महाराष्ट्र के मंत्री नवाब मलिक के खिलाफ उन्हें व उनके परिवार को बदनाम करने को लेकर पुलिस में शिकायत दर्ज कराई है और एफआईआर दर्ज करने की मांग की है। बकौल यास्मीन, उनका ऑनलाइन पीछा किया जा रहा है और मलिक ने सोशल मीडिया से उनकी तस्वीरें लेकर मीडियाकर्मियों को बांटीं।केंद्रीय स्वास्थ्य मंत्री मनसुख मांडविया ने बुधवार को एक कार्यक्रम में कहा, "केंद्र सरकार किसान समर्थक और उद्योग हितैषी है। हम यह देखते हैं कि उद्योग आगे बढ़ें और टिके रहें।" उन्होंने कहा, "आज भारत जेनेरिक दवाओं का सबसे बड़ा निर्माता और आपूर्तिकर्ता है...हम 'वसुधैव कुटुंबकम' में विश्वास करते हैं...हम यह देख रहे हैं कि दुनिया को सस्ती दवा मिले।"राज्यसभा सांसद और वरिष्ठ वकील केटीएस तुलसी ने कहा है, "ड्रग्स हर किसी की ज़िंदगी का हिस्सा हैं...कई मौकों पर ये ज़िंदगी का दर्द कम करते हैं।" उन्होंने संतुलित मात्रा में ड्रग्स के इस्तेमाल की अनुमति की वकालत करते हुए कहा, "शराब, तंबाकू व गुटखा भी नुकसानदायक हैं...लेकिन टैक्स देकर इनके सेवन की इजाज़त है तो ड्रग्स की क्यों नहीं?" असोसिएशन फॉर डेमोक्रेटिक राइट्स (एडीआर) की रिपोर्ट के मुताबिक, 30 अक्टूबर को होने जा रहे विधानसभा उप-चुनावों के 235 उम्मीदवारों में से 44 ने शपथ-पत्र में उनके खिलाफ आपराधिक मामले होने की जानकारी दी है। 36 उम्मीदवारों के खिलाफ गंभीर आपराधिक मामले दर्ज हैं। बकौल रिपोर्ट, 235 में से 77 प्रत्याशी करोड़पति हैं और महिला उम्मीदवारों की संख्या 18 है।एआईएमआईएम प्रमुख असदुद्दीन ओवैसी ने टी20 विश्व कप में भारत के खिलाफ पाकिस्तान की जीत को 'इस्लाम की जीत' बताने वाले पाकिस्तानी मंत्री शेख रशीद अहमद को 'पागल' बताया है। उन्होंने कहा, "इस्लाम को क्रिकेट मैच से क्या करना? लेकिन ये पड़ोसी के लोग समझते नहीं हैं...शुक्र है कि हमारे बुज़ुर्ग वहां नहीं गए वरना इन पागलों को देखना पड़ता।"पंजाब कांग्रेस प्रमुख नवजोत सिंह सिद्धू ने अपनी नई पार्टी बनाने का ऐलान कर चुके अमरिंदर सिंह को लेकर कहा, "आखिरी बार जब आपने अपनी पार्टी बनाई थी, आप चुनाव हार गए...आपको सिर्फ 856 वोट मिले थे।" दरअसल, अमरिंदर ने 1992 में शिरोमणि अकाली दल (पंथिक) नामक पार्टी बनाई थी और बाद में कांग्रेस में उसका विलय कर लिया था।अभिनेत्री काम्या पंजाबी ने कांग्रेस में शामिल होने की अपनी तस्वीरें इंस्टाग्राम पर शेयर कर कैप्शन में लिखा, "नए सफर की खूबसूरत शुरुआत।" उन्होंने लिखा, "मैं राहुल गांधी और प्रियंका गांधी के नेतृत्व में काम करने के लिए उत्साहित हूं।" गौरतलब है, टीवी रिऐलिटी शो 'बिग बॉस 7' की प्रतिभागी रहीं काम्या कई धारावाहिकों में काम कर चुकी हैं।क्रिकेट मैच में भारत पर पाकिस्तान की जीत का जश्न मनाने के आरोप में आगरा (उत्तर प्रदेश) में 3 कश्मीरी छात्रों की गिरफ्तारी को पीडीपी प्रमुख महबूबा मुफ्ती ने निंदनीय कार्रवाई बताया है। उन्होंने कहा, "2 साल के दमन के बाद कश्मीर की स्थिति देखकर केंद्र की आंख खुल जानी चाहिए थी।" उन्होंने छात्रों की रिहाई की मांग की है।रायगंज (पश्चिम बंगाल) से बीजेपी विधायक कृष्ण कल्याणी बुधवार को टीएमसी में शामिल हो गए। कल्याणी ने कहा कि बीजेपी में अच्छे काम का महत्व नहीं है। कल्याणी ने बीजेपी सांसद देबाश्री चौधरी पर उनके खिलाफ साज़िश रचने का आरोप लगाया था। बीजेपी ने कल्याणी को कारण बताओ नोटिस भेजा था जिसके बाद 1-अक्टूबर को उन्होंने पार्टी छोड़ दी थी।  टीएमसी अध्यक्ष ममता बनर्जी द्वारा पश्चिम बंगाल विधासनभा चुनाव में दिए गए 'खेला होबे' नारे की तर्ज पर सपा प्रमुख अखिलेश यादव ने यूपी के आगामी विधानसभा चुनाव के लिए 'खदेड़ा होवे' का नारा दिया है। अखिलेश ने मऊ में कहा, "बंगाल में खेला हुआ...यूपी में खदेड़ा होगा...बीजेपी का सफाया होगा।" वहीं, सपा ने एसबीएसपी के साथ गठबंधन किया है।पेगासस जासूसी मामले में सुप्रीम कोर्ट द्वारा जांच समिति गठित करने के फैसले को कांग्रेस नेता राहुल गांधी ने स्वागत योग्य बताया है। उन्होंने कहा, "यह देश के लोकतांत्रिक ढांचे, जनता व आज़ादी पर हमला है।" बकौल राहुल, "यह हमला करने का निर्देश 2 ही लोग दे सकते हैं और सच सामने आने पर उनके पास जवाब नहीं होगा।"राष्ट्रीय लोकदल (आरएलडी) के अध्यक्ष जयंत चौधरी ने बुधवार को मथुरा में रैली में कहा कि अगर उत्तर प्रदेश में समाजवादी पार्टी और उनकी पार्टी के गठबंधन वाली सरकार बनती है तो वह 1 करोड़ युवाओं को रोज़गार देने की दिशा में काम करेगी। उन्होंने 'किसानों का बिजली बिल माफ करने व भविष्य में हाफ' करने का भी वादा किया।पेगासस मामले की जांच के लिए सुप्रीम कोर्ट द्वारा 3 सदस्यीय समिति बनाए जाने के फैसले को राजस्थान के मुख्यमंत्री अशोक गहलोत ने स्वागत योग्य बताया है। उन्होंने कहा, "जांच से सच सामने आएगा और मोदी सरकार की अलोकतांत्रिक गतिविधियां देश के सामने उजागर होंगी।" बकौल सीएम, "यह सिर्फ निजता के हनन का नहीं...राष्ट्रीय सुरक्षा से खिलवाड़ का मामला है।"कांग्रेस प्रवक्ता पवन खेड़ा ने पार्टी के नेता संजय निरुपम से माफी मांगने वाले पूर्व नियंत्रक एवं महालेखापरीक्षक (सीएजी) विनोद राय को 'फ्रॉड' बताया है। उन्होंने कहा, "जिस आदमी ने अपनी किताब बेचने के लिए संजय निरुपम का नाम लेकर झूठ बोला और आज माफी मांगनी पड़ी...सोचिए उसने किताब में और अपनी सीएजी रिपोर्ट्स में कितने झूठ लिखे होंगे।"असम में होने वाले विधानसभा उप-चुनाव के लिए प्रचार के दौरान मुख्यमंत्री हिमंत बिस्व सरमा द्वारा आचार संहिता के उल्लंघन के मामले में चुनाव आयोग ने उन्हें चेतावनी देकर माफ कर दिया है। आयोग ने कहा, "उन्हें भविष्य में और अधिक सावधान रहने...संयम बरतने और...सार्वजनिक बयानबाज़ी करते समय आदर्श आचार संहिता के प्रावधानों का...सख्ती से पालन करने की दरकार है।"
author: नूतन कुमार गुप्तानूतन कुमार गुप्ताशुभम गुप्ताशुभम गुप्ताजय शंकर ठाकुरजय शंकर ठाकुरअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारshashank mishrashashank mishrashashank mishrashashank mishraवेद प्रकाश शर्मावेद प्रकाश शर्मावेद प्रकाश शर्मावेद प्रकाश शर्माअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारजय शंकर ठाकुरजय शंकर ठाकुरshashank mishrashashank mishrashashank mishrashashank mishrashashank mishrashashank mishrashashank mishrashashank mishrashashank mishrashashank mishraजय शंकर ठाकुरजय शंकर ठाकुरshashank mishrashashank mishraजय शंकर ठाकुरजय शंकर ठाकुरshashank mishrashashank mishraअनिल कुमारअनिल कुमारshashank mishrashashank mishra

title: Grilled myself for hrs: Nitu on preparing for H'wood debut 'Never Back...' | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Actress Nitu Chandra opened up about how she prepared for her role in her Hollywood debut film 'Never Back Down: Revolt'. "I've grilled myself for hours rehearsing my moves and then performing," she said. Nitu added she has performed different forms of martial arts in the upcoming film. She further said her hard work was appreciated by director Kellie Madison.
author: Udit GuptaUdit Gupta

title: White dwarf seen switching on & off for the 1st time: Astronomers | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: Researchers led by Durham University have seen a white dwarf abruptly switching on and off for the first time. The white dwarf observed by the team is known to be accreting, or feeding, from an orbiting companion star. Astronomers saw it lose brightness in 30 minutes, a process which has earlier been observed to occur over several days to months.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Services on Delhi Metro's Yellow Line to be unavailable for few hrs tomorrow | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation has said that Yellow Line services, between the Vishwavidyalaya and the Model Town stations, will not be available till 7:30 am on Sunday morning amid maintenance work. GTB Nagar metro station will also remain closed during this period. "To ensure connectivity between this section during this period, free feeder bus service will remain available," DMRC added.
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

title: B'luru man assaulted by 3 friends for refusing to buy them cigarettes  | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: A 21-year-old man was allegedly assaulted by his three friends after he refused to buy cigarettes for them in Bengaluru. As per the victim, one of the accused attacked him with a machete and fled the spot after committing the offence. While two of the accused have been arrested by the police, one is still on the run.
author: Ridham GambhirRidham Gambhir

title: Remains of the largest known triceratops 'Big John' sold for €6.65 mn | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: An anonymous US collector bought the fossilised remains of 'Big John', the largest triceratops dinosaur ever discovered by paleontologists, for €6.65 million (almost ₹58 crore) at a Paris auction on Thursday. 'Big John' is named after the owner of the land where the dinosaur's bones were found. It roamed modern-day South Dakota more than 66 million years ago.
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: Will give e-scooters, smartphones to girls if Cong wins UP polls: Priyanka | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra promised on Thursday to provide smartphones to class 12 pass girls and e-scooters to all graduate girl students if her party wins the upcoming Uttar Pradesh elections. She met some girl students who put forth the demand for smartphones for studies and their security. Earlier, Gandhi promised 40% tickets to women in the UP elections.
author: Jigyasu JoshiJigyasu Joshi

title: New species of snail discovered in a limestone cave in Meghalaya | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: A new micro snail species was found deep inside a limestone cave at Mawsmai village in Meghalaya's East Khasi Hills district. The discovery was made by Nipu Kumar Das and Aravind Madhyastha, scientists of the Bengaluru-based Ashoka Trust for Research in Ecology and the Environment (ATREE). The new species was named 'Georissa mawsmaiensis' after the limestone cave in Mawsmai.
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: Kareena shares throwback pic with Saif on 9th wedding anniversary | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan took to Instagram on Saturday to share a throwback picture with Saif Ali Khan on the occasion of their ninth wedding anniversary. "Once upon a time in Greece...there was a bowl of soup and US and it changed my life," she wrote. "Happy anniversary to the most handsome man in the world," Kareena added.
author: Udit GuptaUdit Gupta

title: NASA delays launch of Artemis I mission to the Moon to February | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: NASA will be launching its uncrewed Artemis I mission to the Moon in February 2022. The mission was originally scheduled to launch in November, with astronauts set to land on the Moon by 2024. NASA has completed stacking the Orion spacecraft on top of the giant Space Launch System rocket. This mission is expected to last for a few weeks.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Celebs criticise media for mobbing SRK, Sonu Sood says 'Not every news is news' | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Celebrities, including Sonu Sood, Hansal Mehta and Pooja Bhatt criticised media for mobbing Shah Rukh Khan as he left Arthur Road Jail after meeting Aryan. "Before running after someone's feelings with a camera, remember God's camera is focussed on you...Not every news is news," tweeted Sonu. "How do you...explain this pack like behaviour to your own children?" wrote Pooja.
author: Daisy MowkeDaisy Mowke

title: First dinosaur era crab fully preserved in amber found: Harvard | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: An international team of scientists have discovered the first dinosaur era crab fully preserved in amber, Harvard University reported. "The specimen is spectacular, it is one of a kind. It's absolutely complete and is not missing a single hair on the body, which is remarkable," a scientist said. The species has been named Cretapsara athanata.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Hrithik Roshan to sing for 'Krrish 4', reveals Rajesh Roshan | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Actor Hrithik Roshan will sing a song in his upcoming superhero film 'Krrish 4', music director Rajesh Roshan has confirmed. "There will be one song for sure," he said in an interview. Hrithik has earlier lent his voice for songs like 'Senorita' from 'Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara' and 'Kites In The Sky' from 'Kites'.
author: Udit GuptaUdit Gupta

title: Darwin's microscope designed around 1825 to be auctioned for ₹3.6 crore | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: A microscope of naturalist Charles Darwin, which he gave to his son Leonard, will be put up for auction in December. It was reportedly designed around 1825 and is one of six surviving microscopes associated with Darwin. It will be offered at a Christie's auction on December 15 and has a price estimate of up to ₹3.6 crore.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Bezos' Blue Origin unveils plans to build a private space station | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: Jeff Bezos-founded Blue Origin has unveiled plans to build a private space station that will operate as an "off-world mixed use business park". The planned station, called 'Orbital Reef', will be able to house up to 10 people and provide a place for commerce, research, tourism. The company plans to deploy the station by the end of this decade.
author: Hiral GoyalHiral Goyal

title: China launches 2nd crewed mission to build its space station | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: China on Saturday launched a rocket carrying three astronauts, two men and one woman, to the core module of its new space station for a six-month stay. The Shenzhou-13 mission is the second of four crewed missions needed to complete the space station. This is reportedly the country's longest crewed mission to date.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Gaikwad is a champion, allows me to play my role: CSK's Du Plessis | Sports News | Inshorts
news_articles: Talking about CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad's batting performance in IPL 2021, teammate Faf du Plessis said his teammate is a "champion" and added he's a bright talent. "[Gaikwad] just allows me to play my role and give some experience to him. He's a young gun," he added. Gaikwad with 635 runs ended as the highest run-scorer this season.
author: Anant KaurAnant Kaur

title: Signs of 1st possible planet outside our galaxy found: NASA | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: Researchers may have detected the signs of a planet transiting a star outside of the Milky Way for the first time, NASA revealed. The possible exoplanet is located in a binary system 'M51-ULS-1' in Messier 51 galaxy. The system contains a black hole or neutron star orbiting a companion star with a mass about 20 times that of the Sun.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Couldn't be happier for Ruturaj Gaikwad: CSK head coach Fleming | Sports News | Inshorts
news_articles: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming said he couldn't be happier for Ruturaj Gaikwad after his performance in IPL 2021. Fleming called Gaikwad an "absolute superstar" and added that the Ruturaj-Faf du Plessis partnership was "one of the real reasons" behind winning IPL. The 24-year-old became the youngest-ever Orange Cap winner in IPL history after scoring 635 runs this season.
author: Amartya SharmaAmartya Sharma

title: Support proposal to waive patents on COVID-19 vaccines: US to WTO members | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: The White House has called on all World Trade Organization (WTO) members to support a proposal to waive patents on coronavirus vaccines. India and South Africa had proposed the move last year, saying it would increase vaccine production around the world. Over 100 countries have backed the proposal, but the European Union and several countries, including Switzerland, have opposed it.
author: Athira SasidharanAthira Sasidharan

title: Astronaut shares pic of racetrack in Italy taken from space | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: NASA astronaut Shane Kimbrough took to social media to share a picture of a racetrack taken from International Space Station. "Any guesses where this is? If you guessed southern Italy, you are correct!" he wrote in the caption. "It is the home to Porsche Engineering and the Nardo Technical Center," Kimbrough added.
author: Daisy MowkeDaisy Mowke

title: 2,500 ancient structures' ruins found on Mexico train route: Experts | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: The ruins of almost 2,500 pre-Hispanic structures and 80 burial sites have been detected on just one-sixth of the route of the "Maya Train" project in Mexico. Mexico's National Institute of Anthropology and History described the ruins as being on the project's edge. The finds range from pottery and simple stone outlines of thatched pre-Hispanic Maya homes to ceremonial platforms.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: New whistleblower says Facebook allowed illegal drug trade in groups: Report | Technology News | Inshorts
news_articles: A new Facebook whistleblower has said the firm enabled illegal drug trades to occur within private groups, The Washington Post reported. Facebook officials told the whistleblower "we need to focus on the good" after the whistleblower raised concerns internally. "It sets a dangerous precedent to hang an entire story on a single source making...claims without any...corroboration," Facebook said.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Fabindia withdraws Jashn-e-Riwaaz ad after criticism, says 'it's not Diwali collection' | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Clothing brand Fabindia has removed an advertisement about its festive line after criticism. While the brand was accused of "defacing" Hindu festival of Diwali by naming its festive collection as Jashn-e-Riwaaz (celebration of traditions), Fabindia insisted it's not a Diwali collection. "We've...always stood for...celebration of India with its myriad traditions in all hues," a spokesperson said.
author: Daisy MowkeDaisy Mowke

title: Science News: Latest Science News Updates in Hindi with Inshorts
news_articles: पीएम2.5 ऐसे प्रदूषणकारी तत्वों को दर्शाते हैं जिनका आकार 2.5 माइक्रोमीटर से भी कम होता है। ठोस प्रदूषक तत्वों और तरल पदार्थों के मिश्रण से बने ऐसे कण व्यक्ति के फेफड़ों और रक्त प्रवाह तक पहुंच सकते हैं और सांस संबंधी बीमारियों का कारण बन सकते हैं। फिलहाल, दिल्ली का पीएम2.5 स्तर डब्ल्यूएचओ के मानक से 20 गुना अधिक है।  ब्रिटेन स्थित शोधकर्ताओं को प्रशांत महासागर में करीब 11 किलोमीटर गहराई पर मिलने वाले जीव-जंतुओं के पेट में प्लास्टिक फाइबर मिले हैं। शोधकर्ताओं ने समुद्र में सर्वाधिक गहराई वाले ज्ञात स्थान चैलेंजर डीप (मारियाना गर्त) समेत गर्तों में मिलने वाले जीवों के सैंपल का अध्ययन किया था। 1950 से अब तक 8.3 अरब टन प्लास्टिक के उत्पादन का अनुमान है।अमेरिकी वैज्ञानिकों ने मानव शरीर में एक नए अंग 'इंटरस्टिसम' (interstitium) की खोज का दावा किया है जो त्वचा के ठीक नीचे, नसों, धमनियों, मांसपेशियों के बीच ऊतकों, पाचन तंत्र और मूत्र प्रणाली के आसपास हो सकता है। पहले हुए अध्ययनों में इसे एक कनेक्टिव ऊतक बताया गया था। यह मानव शरीर के सबसे बड़े अंगों में से एक है।'कौन बनेगा करोड़पति 9' में ₹7 करोड़ का जैकपॉट प्रश्न नोबेल पुरस्कार से जुड़ा था। प्रतिभागी अनामिका मजूमदार से पूछा गया था कि 4 विकल्पों में से कौन सी अभिभावक-बच्चे की जोड़ी नोबेल पुरस्कार विजेता नहीं है। इस सीज़न में ₹1 करोड़ जीतने वाली पहली प्रतिभागी अनामिका ने सही उत्तर (विकल्प डी) ना पता होने पर खेल छोड़ दिया था।इटली के एस्ट्रोनॉट पाओलो नेसपोली ने दिवाली की रात अंतरिक्ष से ली गई भारत की तस्वीर ट्वीट करते हुए दिवाली की शुभकामनाएं दी हैं। 60 वर्षीय नेसपोली ने ट्वीट किया, " आज हिंदुओं का प्रकाश पर्व दिवाली है। सभी को दिवाली की शुभकामनाएं।" गौरतलब है कि नेसपोली इस समय यूरोपियन स्पेस एजेंसी की तरफ से स्पेस मिशन पर हैं।एक टॉक शो के दौरान स्पेसX सीईओ एलन मस्क के व्हिस्की व गांजे का सेवन करने के बारे में पता चलने के बाद नासा द्वारा कंपनी की सुरक्षा समीक्षा किए जाने की रिपोर्ट है। नासा के प्रशासक जिम ब्राइडेन्सटाइन का कहना है कि अमेरिकी लोगों को यह दिखाने की ज़रूरत है कि रॉकेट में जाने वाला अंतरिक्षयात्री सुरक्षित रहेगा।साइंस अलर्ट जर्नल में छपे अध्ययन के मुताबिक, खगोलविदों ने ब्रह्मांड के सबसे पुराने तारों में से एक '2MASS J18082002-5104378 B' की पहचान की है जो 13.5 अरब वर्ष से ब्रह्मांड में मौजूद है। खगोलविदों ने बताया कि इस तारे का द्रव्यमान सूर्य के द्रव्यमान का सिर्फ 10% है जिसके कारण इसकी अब तक मिल्की वे में पहचान नहीं हुई।न्यू साइंटिस्ट मैगज़ीन के मुताबिक, रूसी-इज़रायली अरबपति यूरी मिलनर का 'ब्रेकथ्रू स्टारशॉट' फॉउंडेशन शनि ग्रह के 'एनसेलडस' चंद्रमा पर एलियन जीवन की खोज के लिए नासा के साथ मिलकर काम कर रहा है। वैज्ञानिकों का मानना है कि सौरमंडल (पृथ्वी) में पृथ्वी के अलावा सिर्फ बर्फीले चंद्रमा (-198°C) एनसेलडस पर जीवन के लिए आवश्यक सभी तत्व मौजूद हैं।27 जुलाई को 21वीं शताब्दी का सबसे लंबा पूर्ण चंद्र ग्रहण होगा, जो 103 मिनट रहेगा और मुख्यत: भारत, अफ्रीका, पश्चिम एशिया, ऑस्ट्रेलिया और यूरोप में दिखेगा। पृथ्वी की छाया के मध्य से चंद्रमा के सीधे गुज़रने के कारण अवधि इतनी लंबी होगी। इस दौरान सूर्य से अधिकतम दूरी पर होने के कारण पृथ्वी की छाया का आकार बड़ा होगा।अमेरिकी खगोलशास्त्री नील दीग्रास टायसन ने कहा है कि अंतरिक्ष अन्वेषण (स्पेस एक्सप्लोरेशन) दुनिया में शांति लाने में मदद कर सकता है क्योंकि इससे संसाधनों के लिए हो रहे युद्ध खत्म हो जाएंगे। उन्होंने कहा, "अगले 60 वर्षों में सौरमंडल हमारा बैकयार्ड बन सकता है...अगर ऐसा हुआ तो हम पृथ्वी पर दुर्लभ संसाधनों का अंतरिक्ष से दोहन कर सकते हैं।"अमेरिका स्थित एसईटीआई इंस्टीट्यूट के खगोलविदों ने स्पेस मिशन न्यू होराइज़न के डेटा का अध्ययन कर बताया है कि प्लूटो की सतह पर करीब चार अरब वर्ष पहले बड़ी मात्रा में नाइट्रोजन की जमी हुई परतें थीं। बतौर अध्ययन, प्लूटो के मौसम में बहुत तेज़ी से हुए परिवर्तन के कारण वहां मौजूद नाइट्रोजन की परतें गैस में बदल गईं।चीन ने 'कृत्रिम सूर्य' बनाया है जो सूर्य के कोर से लगभग 6 गुना अधिक तापमान (10 करोड़ डिग्री सेल्सियस) उत्पन्न करने में सक्षम है। इस प्रोजेक्ट का उद्देश्य सूर्य पर होने वाली प्रक्रियाओं की तरह हाइड्रोज़न का इस्तेमाल कर कम लागत में हरित ऊर्जा (ग्रीन एनर्जी) बनाना है। इससे पहले चीन 'कृत्रिम चंद्रमा' भी विकसित कर चुका है।कनाडा का एक वीडियो सामने आया है जिसमें तेज़ बहती हवाओं के चलते जंगल की सतह 'सांस लेती दिख' रही है जबकि इस क्षेत्र में काफी पेड़ हैं। शोधकर्ताओं का दावा है कि ऐसी घटनाएं तब होती हैं जब ज़मीन में पानी की मात्रा अधिक होती है जिसके कारण मिट्टी और पेड़ों की जड़ों का जुड़ाव कमज़ोर हो जाता है।इंटरनैशनल स्पेस स्टेशन (आईएसएस) में मिले छेद को लेकर नासा के अधिकारी जिम ब्रिडेन्स्टाइन ने कहा है कि बिना किसी साज़िश और अफवाह के इसकी जांच होनी चाहिए। उन्होंने कहा, "मुझे भरोसा है कि हम आईएसएस में मिले छेद का कारण पता लगाने में सफल रहेंगे।" रूसी स्पेस एजेंसी के मुताबिक, यह जानबूझकर किया गया हमला हो सकता है।ऑक्सफोर्ड यूनिवर्सिटी के वैज्ञानिकों ने दावा किया है कि 224-383 ई. में बख्शाली पांडुलिपि में लिखी गई प्राचीन भारतीय पाठ्यसामग्री शून्य के अस्तित्व का सबसे पुराना साक्ष्य है। वैज्ञानिकों का कहना है कि दस्तावेज़ में शून्य को अंक के बजाय एक डॉट सिंबल के तौर पर दर्शाया गया है जिसने बाद में अपना मौजूदा रूप हासिल कर लिया।  लॉन्च के करीब 7 महीने के बाद 45.8 करोड़ किलोमीटर की यात्रा कर मंगल ग्रह पर पहुंचे नासा के अंतरिक्षयान इनसाइट ने पहली तस्वीर साझा की है जिसमें एलीसियम प्लैनीशिया नाम का क्षेत्र दिखाई दे रहा है। 360 किलोग्राम वज़नी अंतरिक्षयान इस क्षेत्र में 5 मीटर तक खुदाई करेगा और भूकंपीय गतिविधियों व अंदरूनी सतह का अध्ययन करेगा।ब्रिटिश वैज्ञानिक स्टीफन हॉकिंग ने मृत्यु से पहले अपनी किताब में लिखा था, "ईश्वर और जन्नत नाम की कोई चीज़ नहीं है...ब्रह्मांड को कोई भी संचालित नहीं कर रहा है।" उन्होंने भविष्य के बारे में बताते हुए कहा, "हां भी और नहीं भी...सिद्धांत हमें भविष्य का अनुमान लगाने की अनुमति देते हैं लेकिन व्यावहारिक रूप से यह बहुत कठिन है।"अमेरिकी वैज्ञानिकों ने चूहों पर अध्ययन कर दावा किया है कि मच्छर से होने वाला ज़ीका वायरस 'ग्लायोब्लास्टोमा' (सामान्यतया होने वाला दिमागी कैंसर) के लिए ज़िम्मेदार कैंसर कोशिकाओं को नष्ट कर सकता है। बतौर अध्ययन, यह वायरस शरीर में कैंसर स्टेम सेल्स (कोशिकाएं) को निशाना बनाता है। इस अध्ययन का प्रयोग मानव पर 18 महीने के अंदर हो सकता है।यूरोपीय और जापानी स्पेस एजेंसी द्वारा बुध ग्रह के लिए लॉन्च हुए 7 वर्षीय मिशन के तहत 'बेपीकोलंबो' स्पेसक्राफ्ट ने अंतरिक्ष से पहली सेल्फी भेजी है जिसमें उसके सोलर पैनल और सन सेंसर दिख रहे हैं। गौरतलब है, 1973 और 2004 के मिशन के बाद बुध के लिए यह तीसरा मिशन है जो 2025 में बुध की कक्षा में पहुंचेगा।अमेरिकी वैज्ञानिकों को एक वानर प्रजाति के दांत का 1.25 करोड़ साल पुराना जीवाश्म मिला है जिसके मुताबिक यह दुनिया में अब तक की सबसे छोटी वानर प्रजाति हो सकती है। विलुप्त हो चुकी इस 'सिमिलस मिन्यूटस' प्रजाति के वानरों का वज़न सिर्फ 3.6 किलोग्राम था। बतौर वैज्ञानिक, जीवाश्म से पता चला है कि ये बंदर पत्तियां खाते थे।स्टैनफोर्ड यूनिवर्सिटी (अमेरिका) के वैज्ञानिकों ने रक्त में पाए जाने वाले डीएनए फ्रैगमेन्ट्स के आधार पर बताया है कि मानव शरीर में मौजूद 99% रोगाणुओं (माइक्रोब्स) के बारे में विज्ञान को कोई जानकारी नहीं है। शोधकर्ता स्टीफेन क्वेक ने बताया कि अध्ययन में उन्हें जो जानकारियां मिली हैं, उनमें से कई जानकारियां अलग और बिलकुल नई हैं।एमेज़ॉन के सीईओ जेफ बेज़ोस का दावा है कि एक दिन ऐसा आएगा जब अंतरिक्ष में एक खरब लोग रहेंगे। उन्हें उम्मीद है कि उनकी एरोस्पेस कंपनी ब्लू ओरिजिन दूसरे ग्रहों पर इंसानों को बसाने में मदद करेगी। हालांकि, उन्होंने माना कि इस मिशन में अभी काफी समय लगेगा और वह इसे देखने के लिए जीवित नहीं रहेंगे।जापानी वैज्ञानिकों ने पहली बार CRISPR/Cas9 जीन एडिटिंग तकनीक की मदद से फूल का रंग बैंगनी से सफेद कर दिया। इसके लिए वैज्ञानिकों ने फूल के एक जीन में बदलाव किए और इसकी सफलता दर 75% रही। इस तकनीक में डीएनए के एक हिस्से के दो सिरों को काट दिया जाता है, जिसकी मदद से डीएनए में बदलाव होता है।एक अध्ययन के मुताबिक, इंसानों द्वारा जैव विविधता और स्तनपायी प्रजातियों को पहुंचाई गई क्षति से उबरने में करीब 50 लाख वर्ष लगेंगे। बतौर शोधकर्ता, मनुष्यों के चलते स्तनपायी जीव बहुत तेज़ी से विलुप्त हो रहे हैं जबकि उनके विकास की दर काफी कम है। 50 वर्षों में काले गैंडे और एशियाई हाथी जैसी कई प्रजातियां विलुप्त हो सकती हैं।दिसंबर में रूसी रॉकेट सोयुज़ से दो यात्रियों के साथ इंटरनैशनल स्पेस स्टेशन (आईएसएस) जाने वाली अमेरिकी महिला अंतरिक्षयात्री ऐनी मैकक्लेन ने कहा है, "मैं रॉकेट से अंतरिक्ष जाने के लिए उत्सुक हूं...मुझे लगता है कि यह सब एक नया अनुभव होगा।" दरअसल, 11 अक्टूबर को सोयुज़ में खराबी आने पर उसमें मौजूद दो अंतरिक्षयात्रियों ने इमरजेंसी लैंडिंग की थी।

title: The subject of sex is still a taboo in India: Sanya Malhotra | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Actress Sanya Malhotra, who'll be seen in show 'Sasural Wonder Phool', said that sex is still a taboo subject in India, but she believes that things are changing now. She added, "I'm hoping with this show we are able to change a few things...maybe inspire people to be more comfortable when they're talking about sex or sex-related issues."
author: Mahima KharbandaMahima Kharbanda

title: NASA's newly launched Lucy spacecraft faces issues with solar panel | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: NASA has revealed that one of its newly launched spacecraft Lucy's 24-foot-wide solar panels may not be fully latched. It added that both of the solar arrays are producing power and charging the battery and the spacecraft is operating well and is stable. NASA launched Lucy on a 12-year journey on October 16 to explore Jupiter's Trojan asteroids.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Fish found with parasite that eats its tongue and later becomes its tongue | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: A state park in US' Texas has shared a picture of a fish whose tongue was eaten by a parasite, and the parasite later replaced the organ. "This parasite detaches the fish's tongue, attaches itself to the fish's mouth, and becomes its tongue. The parasite then feeds on the fish's mucus," the Galveston Island State Park wrote.
author: Ankush VermaAnkush Verma

title: Plant-based jet fuel could reduce emissions by 68%: US study | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: Aviation fuel derived from a type of mustard plant can replace petroleum-based fuel to reduce carbon emissions by up to 68%, University of Georgia scientist Puneet Dwivedi's study found. It also said producing sustainable aviation fuel from the non-edible oilseed crop costs $0.12-$1.28 per litre, whereas, petroleum-based aviation fuel costs higher when current economic incentives are accounted.
author: Hiral GoyalHiral Goyal

title: I decided to support Doge as it felt like the people's crypto: Elon Musk | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk said he decided to support Doge as "it felt like the people's crypto". He added, "Lots of people I talked to on the production lines at Tesla or building rockets at SpaceX own Doge...They aren't financial experts or Silicon Valley technologists." Earlier, Musk revealed he only owns Bitcoin, Ether and Doge.
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: He has got the wrong idea: Shatner on Prince William's remark on space tourism | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: 'Star Trek' actor William Shatner, who became the oldest person to fly to space, responded to Prince William's criticism about "space tourism". Prince William said Earth should first be fixed instead of trying to find the next place to go. "He's...got the wrong idea," stated Shatner, adding that the efforts were first step in taking polluting industries off of Earth.
author: Daisy MowkeDaisy Mowke

title: Ready for sequel on Moon: Russian filmmaker who shot movie in space | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Russian filmmaker Klim Shipenko, who has reportedly filmed the first movie in space, has said that the team is ready for a possible sequel on the Moon. Shipenko said that he believes space cinema should be filmed in space. "If it's about the Moon, let's go to the Moon, if it's Mars, let's go to Mars," the filmmaker added.
author: Kriti KambiriKriti Kambiri

title: Starship could be ready for 1st orbital launch in Nov: Elon Musk | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said Starship could be ready for its first orbital launch attempt in November, pending regulatory approval. Earlier this week, SpaceX installed a Raptor vacuum engine and fired it up for the first time while connected to a Starship rocket. Starship is being developed to take people and cargo to the Moon and Mars.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: Tesla briefly surpasses $1 trillion market cap for the first time | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Tesla on Monday briefly surpassed market capitalisation of $1 trillion for the first time ever, after its shares surged over 9.5%. The company's shares hit a record high of more than $998 after American car rental company Hertz placed an order for 1,00,000 Tesla cars. Tesla also became the second-fastest company ever to reach the $1 trillion mark, Bloomberg reported.
author: Hiral GoyalHiral Goyal

title: Video shows people being rescued from submerged bus amid heavy rains in Kerala | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: A video that has surfaced online has shown passengers of a KSRTC bus being rescued amid flooding in Poonjar of Kottayam district in Kerala. Passengers are seen being pulled out of the partially submerged bus. Amid heavy rains, a red alert has been issued in Kottayam where at least 10 people are feared missing after three houses were washed away.
author: Sakshita KhoslaSakshita Khosla

title: Video shows Sasikala getting teary-eyed at Jayalalithaa's memorial | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: Late Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa's aide VK Sasikala on Saturday visited her memorial in Chennai for the first time after being released from jail and got teary-eyed, a video shows. Reacting to her visit, AIADMK's D Jayakumar said, "Her arrival at Amma Memorial has no political impact...For her acting, she may get...Oscar award but no place in AIADMK."
author: Shalini OjhaShalini Ojha

title: K'taka Cong withdraws tweet calling PM 'angootha chhaap', expresses regret | Politics News | Inshorts
news_articles: After a political row erupted over a tweet by Karnataka Congress about Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar expressed his regrets over the "uncivil tweet made by a novice social media manager". Shivakumar also stated that the tweet had been withdrawn. The Karnataka Congress' tweet in Kannada had referred to the PM as "angootha chhaap" (illiterate).
author: Shreyasi BanerjeeShreyasi Banerjee

title: Owl rarely seen in 150 yrs clicked in wild for 1st time: Scientists | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: British scientists working in Ghana have photographed a giant owl, that has rarely been seen for 150 years, for the first time in African rainforests, Imperial College London said. Shelley's Eagle Owl was first described in 1872 from a specimen obtained in Ghana. Scientists said there have been no confirmed sightings of the owl from Ghana since the 1870s.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: What is La Nina, which could lead to dip in temperature in North India in Jan-Feb? | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: La Nina, due to which temperature in North India is expected to fall to 3°C in January and February, is a phenomenon that is characterised by unusually cold ocean temperatures in the Equatorial Pacific. It forms when equatorial trade winds strengthen to bring colder, deep water up from the bottom of the sea, leading to below-normal temperatures in northern hemisphere.
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

title: Japanese billionaire trains in Russia ahead of his space station trip | Startup News | Inshorts
news_articles: Japan's billionaire entrepreneur and Founder of custom-fit apparel brand ZOZO Yusaku Maezawa is training in Russia ahead of his visit to ISS in December as a space tourist. "I've been alive for 45 years and have not experienced anything like that," Maezawa said about experiencing zero gravity. Russian cosmonaut Alexander Misurkin will accompany Maezawa on his 12-day visit.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: SEBI bans investment advisors from advising on unregulated products, digital gold | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) on October 21 announced that registered investment advisors are barred from advising on unregulated products, including digital gold. Offering advisory, distribution, execution, or implementation of services in unregulated instruments is not in accordance with the provisions of Section 12(1) of the SEBI Act, 1992, it added.
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: CBI arrests six people for derogatory posts against judiciary | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Friday arrested six people for allegedly making derogatory posts on social media against the judges of Andhra Pradesh High Court and the judiciary, CBI officials said. CBI registered a case in November 2020 and took over the investigation of 12 FIRs from the state's Crime Investigation Department (CID). CBI had earlier arrested five accused.
author: Atul MishraAtul Mishra

title: Senior al-Qaeda leader killed in US drone strike in Syria | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: The US military said it'd killed a senior al-Qaeda leader Abdul Hamid al-Matar in a drone strike in Syria on Friday. This comes two days after a US outpost in Syria was attacked. "The removal of the...leader will disrupt the terrorist organisation's ability to further plot and carry out global attacks threatening US citizens," US Army Major John Rigsbee said.
author: Athira SasidharanAthira Sasidharan

title: NASA launches spacecraft on a 12-year journey to explore Trojan asteroids | Science News | Inshorts
news_articles: NASA has launched its Lucy Mission which will travel 12 years to study Jupiter's Trojan asteroids. The Lucy space probe was launched using an Atlas V rocket from United Launch Alliance, a joint venture of Boeing and Lockheed Martin Corp. The probe will be observing one main belt asteroid and seven Trojan asteroids.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: 59 thermal plants left with less than 4 days of fuel stocks amid coal shortage | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Fifty-nine thermal power plants in the country had dry fuel stocks for less than four days as of Wednesday, down from 61 a day ago, according to official data. The number of plants with zero days of coal came down to 15. The number of plants with one day of coal stocks came down to 21 with 25,810 MW capacity.
author: Pragya SwastikPragya Swastik

title: Unusually high: Singapore as it sees its highest COVID-19 cases since pandemic began | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: Singapore has recorded 5,324 new infections of COVID-19, its highest such figure since the beginning of the pandemic. "The infection numbers are unusually high," the health ministry said in a statement. "We are looking into this unusual surge in cases within a relatively short window, and closely monitoring the trends for the next few days," it added.
author: Ankush VermaAnkush Verma

title: Police stop commuters, check phones for 'ganja, drugs' chats in Hyd | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: A video has surfaced online, showing police officers in Hyderabad stopping commuters on the road and checking their phones allegedly to look for chats on ganja or other drugs. "We are not forcing anybody nor are we snatching away their phones to check. People are cooperating," Senior police officer Gajarao Bhupal said. "I don't think there's anything illegal," he added.
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

title: Kim Jong-un asks North Koreans to eat less until 2025 amid food crisis: Reports | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has asked his country's citizens to eat less until 2025 amid food crisis, according to reports. North Korean officials have said that people have to accept the shortages until the country reopens its borders with China in 2025, the reports added. "The food situation right now is already clearly an emergency," a resident reportedly said.
author: Arshiya ChopraArshiya Chopra

title: 'Man who takes 6 months parental leave is a loser,' says Palantir Co-founder | Business News | Inshorts
news_articles: Several Twitter users criticised US-based Palantir Technologies' Co-founder Joe Lonsdale after he said, "Any man in an important position who takes six months of leave for a newborn is a loser." Lonsdale was responding to a tweet about US Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg, who took leave for his child. "Respect that people have different choices," Initialized Capital's Garry Tan wrote.
author: Kiran KhatriKiran Khatri

title: China to build outpost for Tajikistan special forces near Afghan border | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: China will finance the construction of an outpost for a special forces unit of Tajikistan's police near the Tajik-Afghan border, Tajikistan's Parliament announced on Thursday. "No Chinese troops will be stationed at the facility," a parliament spokesperson said. The decision to build the military outpost comes amid tensions between Tajikistan's government and Afghanistan's new Taliban rulers.
author: Athira SasidharanAthira Sasidharan

title: Aryan Khan granted bail by Bombay High Court in Mumbai cruise drugs case | Entertainment News | Inshorts
news_articles: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan has been granted bail by Bombay High Court in Mumbai cruise drugs case. Aryan's bail pleas were earlier rejected by both magistrate's court and special NDPS court. He was detained by Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on October 2 and was later arrested. The NCB had busted a rave party on the cruise.
author: Anmol SharmaAnmol Sharma

title: Turkey's second largest lake dries up due to climate change | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: Lake Tuz, Turkey's second-largest lake has entirely dried up due to the climate change-induced drought and "harmful agricultural policies". "There were about 50,000...flamingos. They all perished because there was no water [in the lake]," said Fahri Tunc, Turkish environmental group Doga Dernegi's head. Climate experts warn the Mediterranean basin, including Turkey, is at risk of severe drought.
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

title: Afghanistan is confronting an epic humanitarian crisis: UN chief | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: During a regional conference of Afghanistan's neighbours, UN chief Antonio Guterres said that Afghanistan is "confronting an epic humanitarian crisis and is on the verge of a development catastrophe". He said countries must unite and act urgently to secure a better future for Afghan people. Guterres urged countries to revive the Afghan economy, which is on the brink of collapse.
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

title: Sedition law to be invoked against those celebrating Pak's T20 victory: UP CM | National News | Inshorts
news_articles: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that sedition law will be invoked against those celebrating Pakistan's victory over India in the T20 World Cup match held in Dubai on Sunday. CM Yogi's statement comes a day after Uttar Pradesh Police booked seven people and arrested five people for celebrating Pakistan's victory in the match.
author: Sakshi SharmaSakshi Sharma

title: 200 mn kids live in nations unprepared to deploy remote learning: UNICEF | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: A UNICEF report said at least 200 million children live in 31 low-and middle-income countries that remain unprepared to deploy remote learning in future emergency school closures. Schools in 14 nations were kept closed for at least half of the COVID-19 pandemic, leaving 102 million kids without education. Schoolchildren in West and Central Africa are most affected, the report said.
author: Dharini MudgalDharini Mudgal

title: China opposes any contact between US, Taiwan
content: ANI | Updated: Oct 28, 2021 15:03  ISTBeijing [China], October 28 (ANI/Sputnik): China opposes any military and official contacts between the United States and Taiwan, as well as Washington's interference in Taiwan's affairs, the foreign ministry's spokesman, Wang Wenbin, said on Thursday.The head of the Taiwan administration, Tsai Ing-wen, confirmed to CNN in a fresh interview that US troops are present on the island to train Taiwanese forces. Tsai also claimed that the threat from China is increasing every day and expressed confidence in Washington's support in the event of an attack."The US must adhere to the One China principle and provisions of three US-Chinese communiques. We strongly oppose any official and military contacts between the US and Taiwan, as well as US interference in China's internal affairs," Wang said at a briefing, stressing that the US-Chinese relations are based on the One China principle. (ANI/Sputnik)China military contacts United States Taiwan foreign ministryIndia taking ambitious action for expanding clean, renewable energy, says ShringlaUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:27 ISTUK envoy to UN says feeling 'optimistic' ahead of Glasgow climate summitUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:24 ISTCarefully following discussions, hopeful of WHO recognition for Covaxin soon, says ShringlaUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 23:09 ISTBlinken, French counterpart discuss cooperation in Indo-Pacific, Sahel Updated: Oct 28, 2021 23:06 ISTIranian deputy foreign minister to discuss in Moscow lifting sanctions against TehranUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 22:51 ISTUN Yet to resume flights into Ethiopia's Mekelle amid safety concernsUpdated: Oct 28, 2021 22:43 ISTHong Kong passes bill to censor films contrary to national securitycopyrights © aninews.in | All rights Reserved
news_articles: Beijing [China], October 28 (ANI/Sputnik): China opposes any military and official contacts between the United States and Taiwan, as well as Washington's interference in Taiwan's affairs, the foreign ministry's spokesman, Wang Wenbin, said on Thursday.  The head of the Taiwan administration, Tsai Ing-wen, confirmed to CNN in a fresh interview that US troops are present on the island to train Taiwanese forces. Tsai also claimed that the threat from China is increasing every day and expressed confidence in Washington's support in the event of an attack."The US must adhere to the One China principle and provisions of three US-Chinese communiques. We strongly oppose any official and military contacts between the US and Taiwan, as well as US interference in China's internal affairs," Wang said at a briefing, stressing that the US-Chinese relations are based on the One China principle. (ANI/Sputnik)
category: China opposes any contact between US, Taiwan

title: 907-kg tungsten cube NFT goes on sale, owner can touch cube once a year | Technology News | Inshorts
news_articles: An NFT of a 907-kilogramme tungsten cube has been put up for sale and the minimum bid for it currently stands at $190,858. The NFT owner will be allowed one supervised visit to the cube per year to touch or photograph it. The 14.545-inch cube was created by US-based Midwest Tungsten Service and will be stored at its headquarters.
author: Aishwarya AwasthiAishwarya Awasthi

title: US flight diverted after male passenger assaults flight attendant | World News | Inshorts
news_articles: An American Airlines flight from New York to California was diverted to Denver after a male passenger "physically assaulted" a flight attendant, officials said. Authorities have detained the individual and he has been banned from American Airlines' flights for life, the airline said. The flight attendant was reportedly taken to a hospital, but details on her condition weren't immediately released.
author: Athira SasidharanAthira Sasidharan

title: World News Headlines | Latest International News in Hindi with Inshorts
news_articles: देश में कोविड-19 के नए आउटब्रेक के बीच पूर्वोत्तर चीन के कुछ सीमावर्ती शहरों को हाई अलर्ट पर रखा गया है। शहरों ने यात्रा प्रतिबंध और सार्वजनिक सभाओं पर रोक लगाते हुए कोविड-19 उपायों को सख्ती से लागू कर दिया है जबकि कुछ ने निगरानी व सतर्कता बढ़ा दी है। चीन में बुधवार को संक्रमण के 23 स्थानीय मामले मिले।सिंगापुर में कोविड-19 के 5,324 नए मामले सामने आए हैं जो महामारी की शुरुआत के बाद अब तक का सर्वाधिक आंकड़ा है। स्वास्थ्य मंत्रालय ने एक बयान में कहा, "संक्रमण के मामले असामान्य रूप से ज़्यादा हैं।" मंत्रालय ने कहा, "कम समय में...हुई असामान्य बढ़ोतरी की वजह पता लगाई जा रही है...अगले कुछ दिन...इस पर बारीकी से नज़र रखी जाएगी।"चीन में कोविड-19 के नए आउटब्रेक की आशंकाओं के बीच बीजिंग (चीन) का एक वीडियो सामने आया है जिसमें लोग कोविड-19 टेस्ट करवाने के लिए लाइन में खड़े दिख रहे हैं। लोगों को ज़रूरत पड़ने पर ही घर से बाहर निकलने की सलाह दी गई है। वहीं, 40 लाख की आबादी वाले शहर लानज़ू में लॉकडाउन लगा दिया गया है।फेडरल कोविड-19 सहायता राशि के आवेदन में झूठ बोलने और इन पैसों से $57,789 (₹43 लाख) में एक दुर्लभ पोकेमोन कार्ड खरीदने को लेकर एक शख्स पर धोखाधड़ी का आरोप तय हुआ है। आरोपी ने आवेदन में अपने कर्मचारियों की संख्या और उनकी कंपनी के राजस्व की गलत जानकारी दी थी। आवेदन के बाद उसे $85,000 की सहायता मिली थी।चीन के भूमि सीमा कानून पर भारत सरकार ने कहा है, "चीन द्वारा लाया गया यह कानून सीमा प्रबंधन पर मौजूदा व्यवस्थाओं को प्रभावित कर सकता है...यह एकतरफा फैसला चिंताजनक है।" सरकार ने कहा, "उम्मीद है कि चीन इस कानून की आड़ में ऐसा कोई कदम नहीं उठाएगा जो भारत-चीन सीमा क्षेत्रों की परिस्थितियों में बदलाव ला सकता है।"यूएन ने अपनी 'स्टेट ऑफ दी क्लाइमेट इन एशिया 2020' रिपोर्ट में बताया है कि जलवायु संबंधी संकटों के कारण चीन को सालाना $238 अरब का नुकसान हुआ जो एशिया में सर्वाधिक है। इसके बाद भारत ($87 अरब), जापान ($83 अरब), दक्षिण कोरिया ($24 अरब), रूस ($20 अरब), पाकिस्तान ($15.75 अरब) और थाईलैंड ($12.49 अरब) का स्थान रहा।भारतीय मूल की अनीता आनंद (54) को कनाडा की नई रक्षा मंत्री बनाया गया जिनकी मां का जन्म पंजाब और पिता का तमिलनाडु में हुआ था। स्कॉलर, वकील और शोधकर्ता के रूप में काम कर चुकीं अनीता का जन्म केंटविले में हुआ था। अनीता ने ऑक्सफोर्ड यूनिवर्सिटी से जूरिसप्रूडेंस में बीए और टोरंटो यूनिवर्सिटी से मास्टर ऑफ लॉ किया।थाईलैंड में बहुमंज़िला इमारत की एक महिला निवासी द्वारा रस्सी काटने के बाद 2 पेंटर 26वीं मंज़िल के ऊपर लटके रहे। महिला ने काम को लेकर जानकारी नहीं देने पर ऐसा किया और बाद में पेंटर्स को बचा लिया गया। महिला पर हत्या के प्रयास का आरोप है और दोषी होने पर उसे 20-साल तक की जेल हो सकती है।जून-2020 में लंदन में एक पार्क में 2 बहनों की हत्या करने वाले 19-वर्षीय ब्रिटिश किशोर डैनियल हुसैन को कम-से-कम 35-साल की जेल की सज़ा हुई है। हुसैन ने लॉटरी के लिए 'दानव को बलि चढ़ाने' के मकसद से 46 और 27-वर्षीय 2 बहनों की हत्या की थी। उसका मानना था कि 'बलि' के 6-महीने बाद उसकी लॉटरी लग जाएगी।पेंटागन (अमेरिकी रक्षा विभाग) के एक अधिकारी ने कहा कि इस्लामिक स्टेट-खुरासान (आई.एस.-के) अगले 6-12 महीनों में अमेरिका पर हमला करने में सक्षम होगा लेकिन वर्तमान में ऐसा कोई नहीं कर पाएगा। बकौल अधिकारी, "खुफिया एजेंसियों का आकलन है कि अल-कायदा को फिर से अफगानिस्तान के बाहर अमेरिका पर हमला करने की क्षमता जुटाने में 'एक-दो साल' लग सकते हैं।"रिपोर्ट्स के मुताबिक, उत्तर कोरिया के शीर्ष नेता किम जोंग-उन ने खाद्य संकट के बीच अपने देश के नागरिकों को 2025 तक कम खाने को कहा है। बकौल रिपोर्ट्स, उत्तर कोरियाई अधिकारियों ने कहा है कि जब तक देश 2025 में चीन के साथ अपनी सीमाओं को दोबारा खोल नहीं देता तब तक लोगों को किल्लत को स्वीकार करना होगा।संयुक्त राष्ट्र महासभा के 76वें सत्र के अध्यक्ष अब्दुल्ला शाहिद ने जलवायु परिवर्तन पर चेतावनी देते हुए कहा है, "हम न केवल गलत रास्ते पर हैं बल्कि इस संकट के मुहाने पर खड़े हैं।" उन्होंने कहा, "राष्ट्रों के पास जलवायु परिवर्तन से निपटने के लिए विज्ञान, प्रौद्योगिकी और संसाधन हैं...मानवता को बचाने के लिए निर्णायक साहसिक निर्णय आवश्यक है।"दक्षिण कोरियाई जासूसी एजेंसी के अनुसार, उत्तर कोरिया के 37-वर्षीय नेता किम जोंग-उन ने करीब 20-किलोग्राम वज़न घटाया है और वह बॉडी डबल का इस्तेमाल नहीं कर रहे हैं। बकौल एजेंसी, 2019 में किम का वज़न लगभग 140-किलोग्राम था और तब से उन्होंने अपना वज़न कम किया। एजेंसी ने एक एचडी वीडियो के विश्लेषण के आधार पर यह अनुमान लगाया।कनाडाई प्रधानमंत्री जस्टिन ट्रूडो ने भारतीय मूल की अनीता आनंद को रक्षा मंत्री बनाया है। 54-वर्षीय अनीता भारतीय मूल के रक्षा मंत्री हरजीत सज्जन की जगह लेंगी और वह कनाडा की रक्षा मंत्री बनने वाली दूसरी महिला हैं। इससे पहले खरीद मंत्री के तौर पर कार्यरत अनीता ने कोविड-19 टीके खरीदने के लिए देश के प्रयासों का नेतृत्व किया था।ओमान सरकार ने भारत बायोटेक की 'कोवैक्‍सीन' को मान्‍यता प्राप्‍त कोविड-19 वैक्‍सीन्स की सूची में शामिल कर लिया है। ओमान में भारतीय दूतावास ने बुधवार को इसकी जानकारी दी। आगमन की तारीख से कम-से-कम 14 दिन पहले पूर्ण टीकाकरण करवा चुके भारतीय यात्रियों को अब ओमान में क्वारंटीन नहीं होना पड़ेगा लेकिन कोविड-19 संबंधी अन्य गाइडलाइंस का पालन करना होगा।रूस में बढ़ते कोविड-19 मामलों के बीच राजधानी मॉस्को में आंशिक लॉकडाउन लगाया गया है। इसके तहत मॉस्को में 28 अक्टूबर से 7 नवंबर के बीच सभी गैर-ज़रूरी सेवाएं बंद रहेंगी। गौरतलब है कि रूस में गुरुवार को कोविड-19 के 40,096 नए मामले सामने आए थे जबकि संक्रमित 1,159 लोगों की मौत हो गई थी।चीनी सरकार द्वारा कोविड-19 के बढ़ते मामलों के कारण लगाए गए ताज़ा प्रतिबंधों के बाद देश की शीर्ष हॉट पॉट रेस्टोरेंट चेन का बाज़ार पूंजीकरण 3 दिन में $4 अरब घट गया है। हायडिलाओ इंटरनैशनल होल्डिंग के शेयर इस सप्ताह बुधवार तक 20% तक टूट गए। वहीं, स्वास्थ्य अधिकारियों ने नए संक्रमण से स्थिति और बिगड़ने का अनुमान जताया है।अमेरिका में 'जॉइंट चीफ्स ऑफ स्टाफ' के प्रमुख जनरल मार्क मिले ने कहा है कि चीनी सेना में 'तेज़ी से विस्तार' हो रहा है। उन्होंने कहा, "चीन ने बेहद महत्वपूर्ण हाइपरसोनिक हथियार का परीक्षण किया...यह बड़ी चिंता का विषय है।" हालांकि, चीन ने अगस्त में हाइपरसोनिक मिसाइल के परीक्षण से इनकार करते हुए कहा कि यह स्पेसक्राफ्ट का परीक्षण था।
